text: While analyzing the status of the project, the project manager calculated the ratio between earned value EV and planned value PV and found that the ratio is 1.13. He was not satisfied and decided to crash some critical path activities by adding more resources to these activities as a corrective action. Is his decision correct?
explanation: The schedule performance index (SPI) is a measure of schedule efficiency expressed as the ratio of earned value to planned value. An SPI value less than 1.0 indicates less work was completed than was planned. An SPI greater than 1.0 indicates that more work was completed than was planned. The SPI is equal to the ratio of the EV to the PV. Equation: SPI = EV/PV. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Yes, his decision is correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Performance Index SPI, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is behind schedule. He should compress the schedule.

No, his decision is not correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Performance Index SPI, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is behind schedule. He should use fast tracking not crashing.

No, his decision is not correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Performance Index SPI, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is ahead of schedule. No need to take corrective action.
Yes, his decision is correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Variance SV, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is behind schedule. He should compress the schedule.

text: During measuring project performance for a product development project against project baselines, you found that the schedule performance index (SPI) of 0.93 and the cost performance index (CPI) of 0.82. Generally, What is the reason behind this?
explanation: The project is behind schedule and over budget. Changes in scope may not result in increasing time and cost. When a supplier go out of business this doesn’t necessarily mean that affected activities are on the critical path. When additional equipments are needed this will increase cost and might not increase time. So the correct choice is that equipment is needed for a critical path activity that was delayed and the team purchased a more expensive one instead. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: A supplier went out of business and a new one needed to be found.
An equipment needed for a critical path activity was delayed and project team purchased a more expensive one instead.
Additional equipment needed to be purchased.
The scope was changed.

text: You are a project manager for a construction project that will install glass walls for a new company. The contract between your company and the customer is a time and material contract which stated that your company will get $11 per meter, and your company is doing all the work. The new company has 4 equal sides of 125 meter, and requires the installation of a six-meter diameter banner on one side. Glass walls should be installed at a rate of 100 meter per day. The banner installation will cost $500 and take one day to complete. The banner must be installed before work can begin on that side of the wall. After three days of work, one side is completed, another has 75 meter installed, and the banner is completely installed. So far, $2,700 of the total project budget has been used. What is the current status of the project?
explanation: EV=(125ft+75ft)11+500 = 2700, AC=2700 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: It is over budget with a cost variance of +$125.
The budget is neutral with cost variance of $0.
It is under budget, with a cost variance of +$500 due to the completion of the banner installation.
It is over budget, with a cost variance of -$1,100

text: You are the project manager for a large manufacturing project. During estimating activity costs for your project using three-point estimates, a team member asks you that he needs to add 5% to each activity cost to account for unidentified risks. What should you tell him?
explanation: During estimating activity costs, the project team should estimate the activity costs and the contingency reserve, while management reserves are estimated by management as part of the Determine Budget process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245 and 252

choices.text: He is right, management reserve must be added to account for unidentified risks.
You should instruct him not increase the estimate.
He is right, contingency reserve must be added to account for known-unknowns.
Tell him that you must get sponsor approval before increasing the estimates.

text: You are managing a software project. The project budget seems to be inaccurate. The SPI is 1.15. Two project team members resigned last week and The team has had negative deviation from the activity attributes. What is the best thing for the project manager to do?
explanation: Re-estimating activity attributes is not necessary. The first thing is to calculate SPI and CPI for the project to gain full understanding of the project status. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Re-compute the project schedule and budget.
Re-estimate the activity attributes.
Calculate the cost performance index.
Try to deal with the high turn-over rate in your project.

text: The project manager is analyzing project performance using earned value management tool. He determines that the cost variance is – 10,000 $. What is the best thing to do?
explanation: Schedule variance should be determined firstly to complete the data needed to analyze project status and then take the required corrective action. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Determine the schedule variance.
Make activities in parallel that are planned in series.
Ask for guidance from PMO.
Move resources from the project to one that is not failing.

text: Samuel has been assigned an industrial project to manage. This is his first project to manage. The project is $100,000 over budget. The project team has completed $500,000 worth of work. The project sponsor is worried about the status of the project, he asks Samuel to provide a quick report about the status of the project. Which of the following statements would he mention in his report?
explanation: EV=500,000 and CV=-100,000, AC=600,000. CPI = EV/AC Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 262-263 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The SPI is 1.2
The CPI is 0.83
The CPI is 1.2
The SPI is 0.83

text: Management reserves are often viewed as the part of the budget intended to address:
explanation: Management reserves are an amount of the project budget withheld for management control purposes and are reserved for unforeseen work that is within scope of the project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 252 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 62

choices.text: Anticipated and certain events
Anticipated and uncertain events
Unanticipated events that are within scope of the project
Unanticipated events that are not within scope of the project

text: A software project has been initiated in an adaptive environment. The team decided to build the demo first and add features to the initial product. This is known as:
explanation: Continuous Delivery is the practice of delivering feature increments immediately to customers, often through the use of small batches of work and automation technology. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 151

choices.text: Conduct a spike
Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Behavior-Driven Development
Continuous Delivery

text: Sam has just been promoted to a project manager position and he is managing his first major network rollout project. His sponsor is worried about the status of the project . In order to reduce the boss's stress he calculated the earned value management calculations and offered to the sponsor. The project has a total budget of $80,000 and CPI of 0.95. The project has spent $25,000 of its budget so far. The sponsor needs to know how much more money does Sam plan to spend on the project?
explanation: EAC = BAC / CPI=84,210, ETC = EAC -AC=59210 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: Samuel is managing a product development project that is bugeted at 1,550,000$. The project is supposed to be completed by today, but it is now 76% complete only. The incurred cost to reach this point is 1,315,000$. What is the cost performance index (CPI) at this point?
explanation: AC=1,315,000$, as the project should be finished at this point, so PV = 1,550,000$, EV =0.761,550,000 = 1,178,000. CPI = EV/AC = 1,178,000/1,315,000 = 0.9. SPI = EV/PV = 1,178,000/1,550,000 = 0.76. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100*

text: While monitoring the cost performance in a small project which was budgeted for $85,000 over a 9 weeks period. As of today, you’ve spent $42,000 of your budget to complete work that you originally expected would cost $44,000. According to your schedule, you should have spent $50,000 by this point. Based on this situation, what is the status of the project?
explanation: AC = 42000, EV= 44000, PV = 50000 SPI = EV/PV = 44000/50000 <1 behind schedule CPI = EV/AC = 44000/42000 >1 under budget Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Under budget and ahead of schedule.
Over budget and ahead of schedule.
Under budget and behind schedule.
Over budget and behind schedule.

text: Julian is managing a large construction project with a total budget of $450,000. According to the schedule, his team should have completed 45% of the work by now. But at the latest status report, the team only reported that 40% of the work has actually been completed. The team has spent $165,000 till now on the project. How would he best describe the status of the project?
explanation: EV=180000, PV=202500, AC=165000 EV < PV, EV > AC Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and within its budget.
The project is behind schedule and within its budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and over its budget.
The project is behind schedule and over its budget.

text: You have just been authorized as a project manager for a small project, identified project stakeholders and are moving into project planning. A project stakeholder asks you for the project’s budget and cost baseline. What should you tell him?
explanation: The project budget can be found in the project charter but it is not a detailed one. It is possible to complete the estimate before creating the project management plan because the ROM (Rough Order of Magnitude) estimate is created during the Initiation process. Even small projects must have a budget, so the best choice is that the project budget and baseline will not be finalized and accepted until the planning processes are completed. Domain: Process. Refer to PMBOK 6th edition, page 254 and PMBOK 7th edition, page 62.

choices.text: The project budget and baseline will not be finalized and accepted until the planning processes are completed.
It is impossible to complete an estimate before the project management plan is created.
The project budget can be found in the project charter, which has just been completed.
The project management plan will not contain the project’s budget and baseline; it is a small project.

text: Your sponsor wants to know the Estimate at Completion for your project. The project was budgeted at $30,000, and to date you have spent $20,000 but only completed $10,000 worth of work. You are sure that the future work will be accomplished at the planned rate.
explanation: As the work will be accomplished at the planned rate EAC=AC+BAC-EV= 20000 + 30000 - 10000 = 40000. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: You are a project manager for a large tele-communication project that was initially budgeted at $9,600,000. While preparing for your weekly status report you find that you have spent till now $4,000,000, the cost variance for your project is $-500,000, the schedule performance index is 1.12. In light of this, what is the earned value of the project?
explanation: CV=EV-AC, EV=AC+CV Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

text: Robert is managing a large manufacturing project. Dave is the project sponsor and at the same time he is the direct manager of Robert. Dave wants to know about the earned value calculations. Robert provided him with this data the project total budget is 120,000$, the total amount spent till now is 70,000$ and the team has actually completed 50% worth of work. If the future project work will be accomplished at the planned rate, what should the Estimate at Completion (EAC) be?
explanation: As the future work will be accomplished at the planned rate, so EAC = AC + BAC - EV. EV = 0.5 * 120,000, EV = 60,000$. BAC = 120,000$ and AC = 70,000$. EAC = 70,000+120,000-60,000 = 130,000$. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: You are managing a mechanical project. The sponsor is worried about the status of the project. You provided him with the earned value calculations AC = $24,100, ETC = $44,600, VAC = -$1,600, BAC =$89,000, and EAC = $91,100. Your sponsor asks you to forecast how much money you expect to spend on the remainder of the project. Which is the best estimate to use for this forecast?
explanation: No need for calculations it asks about ETC. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: You are managing a project with a schedule performance index (SPI) of 1.03 and a cost performance index (CPI) of 0.96. How would you best describe this project?
explanation: SPI>1 means ahead of schedule, CPI<1 over budget Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and within its budget.
The project is behind schedule and within its budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and over its budget.
The project is behind schedule and over its budget.

text: Andrew is an accountant who has recently joined XYZ organization which has a long agile approach. Andrew has a good experience in traditional projects, but he has never worked on agile projects before. He asks an agile coach how costs and returns are monitored and tracked on agile projects. Which of the following is a correct answer to Andrew's question?
explanation: Agile approach follows the principle of incremental delivery which means that each release will deliver value. So, ROI can be generated early as soon as value is delivered. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 16

choices.text: It is the same as traditional projects as both use S-curve.
It is the same as traditional projects as both use earned value management.
Cost is not a concern as it is fixed. In agile projects scope is variable.
ROI can be generated while executing the project.

text: You are managing a project which was budgeted at 1,250,000$ and scheduled to be completed within six months. During project executing, the sponsor asked you about the status of the project. You collected the needed data to calculate earned value measurements. You found that the project is 35% complete although it should be 40% complete. You have already spent 550,000 $ to reach this point in the project. What would you tell the sponsor?
explanation: EV is the value of work accomplished. EV = 0.35 * 1,250,000 = 437,500. PV is the value of the planned work = 0.4 * 1,250,000 = 500,000. and AC is the actual incurred cost AC= 550,000. SPI = EV/PV= 0.875. CPI = EV/AC = 0.8. So the project is behind schedule and over budget Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and over budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and under budget.
The project is behind schedule and over budget.
The project is behind schedule and under budget.

text: You are working for a major pipeline project. The project is very important and highly visible for your organization. It is performed using 32 human resources. As you review the project results, you notice that the value of the work accomplished is $1,200,000 at the last reporting point. You know the schedule performance is good, since your SPI is 1.2 while you have spent $1,050,000 to this point, what are the CPI, and the schedule and cost variances?
explanation: EV = 1200000, SPI = 1.2, AC = 1050000, SPI = EV/PV, PV = EV/SPI = 1200000/1.2, PV = 1000000 CPI = EV/AC = 1200000/1050000 = 1.14 SV = EV-PV = 1200000 – 1000000 = 200000 CV = EV-AC = 1200000 – 1050000 = 150000 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

text: The cost baseline is the approved version of the time-phased project budget, excluding any management reserves. It is used as a basis for comparison to actual results. It is displayed in the form of:
explanation: The cost baseline is displayed in the form of S-Curve. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 254 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 189

choices.text: S-Curve
Inverted S-Curve
Bubble Chart
Hierarchical Chart

text: You are a project manager for a tele-communication project, the project is to swap the old network for 2 cities with a new network. You have been asked by top management to cut the project costs by 10% after you submitted them. The top management expect 25% improvement in drop calls as a result of the project. There are 35 stakeholders in the project and the scope of the project is unclear. What is your best course of action?
explanation: If your estimates are accurate then you are ethically and professionally responsible for supporting them. If there is a need to cut project costs then the top management should help the project manager in finding another solution and to evaluate its impacts on project scope, schedule,..etc Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 241 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 55

choices.text: Re-plan to achieve a 35% improvement in drop calls.
Provide an accurate estimate of the actual costs and be able to support your estimates.
Reduce the estimate by 10% as required and note the change in the risk management plan.
Meet with the team to identify where you can find 10% savings.

text: George is the project manager for a construction project. He is currently reviewing the latest work performance report from his team. The report contains the earned value measurements to this point, forecasts and variances. Which of the following values contribute to the greatest risk in the project?
explanation: TCPI is the ratio between work remaining and budget remaining, if it is greater than one, this means that work remaining is greater than budget remaining, which means high risk. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 105

choices.text: TCPI = 1.05
Schedule Variance SV = 1,500$

text: What is the status of the project when the earned value of the project is higher than both the actual costs and planned value?
explanation: When the EV is greater than both PV and AC then this means that the value of all the work completed EV to this point in time is greater than the value of the work planned to be completed PV and the actual costs spent AC. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is performing good as it is running faster than planned and under the planned cost.
The project is not performing good as it is running slower than planned and under the planned cost.
The project is not performing good as it is running slower than planned and over the planned cost.
The project is not performing good as it is running faster than planned and over the planned cost.

text: Contingency reserves are often viewed as the part of the budget intended to address:
explanation: Contingency reserves are often viewed as the part of the budget intended to address the known unknowns that can affect a project. The certain events are facts not risks. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 62

choices.text: Anticipated and certain events
Anticipated and uncertain events
Unanticipated events
Scope Creep

text: Project team members are estimating the costs of the activities that will be performed during the project. They are using three point estimating. The expected cost of the activity based on weighted average distribution equals 500$. The cost of the activity, based on realistic effort assessment for the required work and any predicted expenses equals 480$. The cost based on analysis of the best-case scenario for the activity equals 420$. What is The cost based on analysis of the worst-case scenario for the activity?
explanation: Beta distribution. cE = (cO + 4cM + cP) / 6. cM = 480, cO = 420 , cE = 500. cP = 6cE - cO - 4cM = 6*500 - 420 - 4*480 = 660$ Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245*

text: Jerry is managing a software project. He calls for a meeting with the project team to discuss the current variances. He receives a weekly report from the project team which includes earned value measurements for the project at this point. Which of the following variances contributes to the least risk in the project?
explanation: BAC is how much did we BUDGET for the TOTAL project effort. EAC is what do we currently expect the TOTAL project to cost. If BAC is greater than EAC this means that the planned budget is greater than the estimated budget, so there is enough funds for the project, which means risk is less. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

choices.text: EAC is greater than BAC
BAC is greater than EAC
TCPI = 1.08
ETC is greater than BAC

text: You are managing a construction project in your organization budgeted at 4,000,000$ and scheduled to be completed in 10 months. During project executing, the customer complains that the project is running behind schedule. The sponsor is holding a meeting with you and the customer. The sponsor asked you about the reason of this delay, you answered him that you send a weekly report which contains the earned value measurements of the project. The last report shows that SPI = 1.05 which means that the project is running ahead of schedule not behind schedule. The customer insists that a critical deliverable due date is missed. What is the main problem in this situation?
explanation: The true answer is that you performed some activities not on the critical path earlier than planned, and some on the critical path later than planned. The values of the activities not on the critical path are higher than those on the critical path, which makes EV>PV and so SPI>1 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Your team is not following the communication management plan.
The customer is not following the communication management plan.
You performed some activities not on the critical path earlier than planned and some activities on the critical path later than planned.
You performed some activities on the critical path earlier than planned and some activities not on the critical path later than planned.

text: A cost performance index (CPI) of 0.98 means:
explanation: A cost performance index means how much dollars you get from each dollar invested. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: At this time, we expect the total project to cost 98 percent of the planned cost.
The project is progressing at 98 percent of the rate planned.
When the project is completed, we will have spent 98 percent of the planned cost.
The project is getting 98 cents out of every dollar invested.

text: You are a project manager for a construction project. You are in planning process group and estimating with team members the costs needed to perform the project. The cost of the material pessimistically $120,000, most likely $110,000, and optimistically $100,000. The cost of labor is pessimistically $100,000, most likely $90,000, and optimistically $85,000. The cost of equipment is pessimistically $60,000, optimistically $40,000 and most likely $50,000. The cost for management fees is pessimistically $50,000, most likely $40,000, and optimistically $30,000. What is the probability of the project coming in under $280,000?
explanation: Average Expected Cost = (P+4M+O)/6. Average cost of material = 110,000, labor = 90,833, Equipments = 50,000, Management fees = 40,000. Average Total Cost = 110000+ 90833+50000+40000 = 290833. Average Total Cost = 110000+ 90833+50000+40000 = 290,833. Mean is at 290833 which means that the probability of total cost to be > 290833 = 50% and the probability of total cost to be < 290833 = 50%. So the probability of total cost to be < 280000$ is less than 50%. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245

choices.text: Exact 50 %.
Less than 50%.
Over 50%.
There is not enough information.

text: You are a project manager for a major construction project. The customer is very angry because there is a deliverable due date within two weeks and he believes that your team will not complete the deliverable before the due date. You meet with the customer to reduce his stress and you show him the earned value calculations. They show your cost performance index (CPI) is 1.25, your actual cost (AC) is $400 million, and your planned value (PV) is $490 million. Should your customer be comfortable?
explanation: Since CPI = EV/ AC, then EV= 1.25 400 M= 500 M, so SV= EV-PV = 500-490= 10M, SPI= EV/PV =500/490= 1.02, therefore the project is ahead of schedule, but this doesn’t mean that the activities needed to deliver project deliverables are on schedule, these deliverables might not be on the critical path. So he needs to prove to him that the activities leading to this deliverable are on schedule. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100*

choices.text: Yes, your SPI is 1.05.
Yes, your SV is $10 million.
No, your CPI is too high.
He needs more data.

text: You are managing an industrial project. You performed till now work valued at $15,000, which was planned to cost $12,000. You actually paid $11,000. What is the status of this project?
explanation: SPI = EV / PV = $15,000 / $12,000 = 1.25—so your project is ahead of schedule. CPI = EV / AC = $15,000 / $11,000 = 1.36—so your project is within its budget. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and within its budget.
The project is behind schedule and within its budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and over its budget.
The project is behind schedule and over its budget.

text: Eric is a project manager of a construction project to install new glass windows in an office building. He planned to spend $21,300 on the project, but his costs are going higher than planned, and now he is afraid that his project is spending too much money. Which of the following parameters can he use to determine whether his project is over or under budget?
explanation: Cost variance (CV) is the amount of budget deficit or surplus at a given point in time, expressed as the difference between earned value and the actual cost. It is a measure of cost performance on a project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 262 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: AC
EV
CV
VAC

text: Steven is a project manager for a large scale integration project, which has a tight schedule. He is reporting to Derek, a senior manager who is also the sponsor of the project. Derek called Steven in the middle of the project and asked him about the status of the project, as he doesn't know whether the project is ahead or behind schedule at this moment. Derek wants to know the earned value numbers. Which report should Steven send to him?
explanation: S-Curve is used to display EV, PV and AC data of a certain project. Other mentioned types of reports don't contain earned value numbers. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 189

choices.text: Project Progress Report
S-Curve
Project Status Report
Milestone Chart

text: What is meant by cost risk?
explanation: The first thing to think of is: cost risks are risks or costs? Of course they are risks, so all answers saying it is cost should be eliminated. It is true that some risks cost the project money but this is not the right definition of cost risks. The right definition is that there is a risk that project costs could go higher than planned. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition

choices.text: The cost of all the identified risks if they happen.
There is a risk that project costs could go higher than planned.
There are risks that will cost the project money.
The cost of contingency reserve assigned for residual risks.

text: The project manager in an industrial firm is reporting the project performance during the bi-weekly progress evaluation meeting with the key stakeholders. The planned budget for completing the project to date is 10000000$, the project mangers' calculations shows that the actual work done by the project is 1.2 the planned cost, while the work done is 0.89 the planned work to be done to date, in light of these info the project is considered:
explanation: The CPI = 1.2 and SPI= 0.89 which means the project is under budget but behind schedule. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: On schedule and under budget
On schedule and over budget
Ahead of schedule and under budget
Behind schedule and under budget

text: Robert is managing a large manufacturing project. Dave is the project sponsor and at the same time he is the direct manager of Robert. Dave wants to know about the earned value calculations. Robert provided him with this data the project total budget is 120,000$, the total amount spent till now is 70,000$ and the team has actually completed 50% worth of work. If the CPI is expected to be the same for the remainder of the project, what should the Estimate at Completion (EAC) be?
explanation: If the CPI is expected to be the same for the remainder of the project, so EAC = BAC/CPI. EV = 0.5 * 120,000, EV = 60,000$. BAC = 120,000$ and AC = 70,000$. CPI = EV/AC = 60,000/70,000 = 0.857. EAC = 120,000/0.857 = 140,000$ Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: After analyzing the status of your project, you determine the earned value (EV) = 500,000 $ and the planned value (PV) = 550,000 $. What should you expect at the end of the project as a result if this trend continues?
explanation: Since EV is less than PV, therefore the amount of work performed is less than what was planned, so the project is behind schedule and will finish later than the planned date. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project will finish below the original cost estimate.
The actual cost will be lower than planned.
The estimate at completion will be lower than planned.
The project will finish behind schedule.

text: You have been assigned as a project manager for a new network roll-out project. You are in the process of creating the project charter. You meet with the key stakeholders to solicit their inputs. You meet with the IT manager to know the cost of the IT activities in your project. He informs you that it is impossible to provide a cost estimate without knowing the specific resources who will be assigned to the project. You explain that:
explanation: In project charter you only need ROM estimate. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 241 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 46

choices.text: For now only you need a ROM estimate to be validated later, when you know what resources will be available.
Try first to estimate the needed resources for the IT manager to get accurate estimates.
It is not a problem because stakeholder identification during project initiating will uncover key resources.
Resource cost is not an issue at this point. You will have a realistic budget at the end of project planning.

text: Edwin is managing a large construction project. He and his team are in the planning phase. He is estimating the cost of each activity with the project team. The project sponsor has requested from him to take uncertainty into consideration. Which of the following techniques is the best to use?
explanation: The accuracy of single-point cost estimates may be improved by considering estimation uncertainty and risk and using three estimates to define an approximate range for an activity’s cost. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 244

choices.text: Parametric Estimating
Analogous Estimating
Triangular distribution
Bottom-up Estimating

text: During project executing, a project manager realizes that he needs to decrease project costs. After analyzing all options, he decides to select one of the following options to decrease project costs. Which one of the following will decrease project costs?
explanation: Choosing the component A will not reduce the project cost. Choosing a more experienced resource of course will increase the cost. Performing activities on parallel will increase risks that will increase the costs. So the best choice is to remove a test from the project management plan although it seems not to be the best solution, this will affect quality negatively but will reduce cost. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 241

choices.text: Remove a test from the project management plan.
Change to component A from component B. Component A costs more to purchase, but has a lower life cycle cost than B.
Change activity A to be completed by resource B instead of resource C. Resource B is a more experienced worker.
Move activities B and H to occur concurrently, and accept a 30% increase in the risk that 5 more resources will be needed later.

text: You are a project manager for a tele-communication project. Your project is to extend cables for a landline phone network. The total cost of the project is $52/ meter to lay 4 km of cable under ground. It’s scheduled to take 8 weeks to complete, with an equal amount of cable laid in each week. It’s currently week 5, and your team has laid 1,800 meters of cable so far. What is the SPI of your project?
explanation: EV = 1800 * 52 = 93600 PV = 5/8 * 52 * 4000 = 130000 SPI = EV/PV = 93600/130000 = 0.72 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

text: You are a project manager for a new project and you need to estimate the cost of activities. You asked another more experienced project manager about the most suitable cost estimating technique for your project. The experienced project manager recommended analogous estimating as it is most suitable for your project. What is the benefit of analogous estimating?
explanation: Analogous estimation uses historical data and expert judgment to estimate activity or project duration. It is quick but less accurate than bottom up estimating. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 244

choices.text: It is quick.
It provides a basis for monitoring and controlling and performance measurement.
It gains buy-in from the team because the team creates estimates.
It is more accurate than bottom-up estimating.

text: You are invited to give a training session for the new project team members in your organization on how to use earned value management. You teach them how to calculate schedule performance index and cost performance index and how to use them to assess project performance to project baselines. A new team members asks you at the end of the project what should be the value of SPI. What should you answer him?
explanation: At the end of the project SPI = 1, the actual work should equal to the planned work. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Equal to SV
Zero
Equal to PV

text: Mathew is managing a software project to develop a website for a new press agency. The project is very large and involves 350 stakeholders located in 9 countries speaking 5 different languages. Recently, he noticed that misunderstanding occurred between many stakeholders when using the instant messenger software available in the organization's intranet. He asked the IT department to add emotional faces to the instant messenger software. How can these emotional faces help the sender?
explanation: Encoding means that the message is coded into symbols, such as text, sound or some other medium for transmission. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 371

choices.text: Decode the message correctly.
Encode the message correctly.
Send correct feedback.
Send correct acknowledge.

text: Matt is an agile practitioner working on a software project. Midway through the project, the team tells him that they need feedback from some key subject matter experts who aren't assigned to the project. How should Matt respond?
explanation: During product demonstration, the team demonstrates all completed work items at the end of the iteration. SME's can be invited to provide their feedback. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 55

choices.text: Ask the sponsor to assign more full-time subject matter experts to the project.
Remind the team that they can get all the feedback they need from the product owner, instead of going outside the project.
Invite those subject matter experts to participate in the team's product demo meetings and provide their feedback.
Ask the team to proceed, since they have all the expertise needed to complete the project.

text: A software organization is moving towards agile approach in managing its projects. This approach is new to the organization, and the project manager's role with these new teams hasn't been clearly defined. Ann is a project manager in this organization. She decides to attend her team's user story writing workshops. Why does she think these sessions are a good use of her limited time?
explanation: Attending the user story writing workshop will build good relationships with team members and will help her understand the features of the product as they will be broken down into user stories. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 58

choices.text: She wants to build strong relationships with the development team members and make sure there is a shared understanding of the product features.
She wants to build strong relationships with the business stakeholders, while the agile coach manages the development team.
She wants to make sure the requirements will deliver the planned scope and be released on time, by the project deadline.
She plans to document the requirements in a requirements traceability matrix to make sure all the work contributes to achieving the project objectives.

text: Alfrid is attending a project management training session. He is watching the speaker to pick up physical gestures and facial expressions. He confirms he is listening, expresses agreement or disagreement and summarizing what he says. Which communication skill does he have?
explanation: Listening actively means staying engaged with the speaker and summarizing conversations to ensure effective information exchange. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 363 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 12 and 21

choices.text: Active listening
Clarity and Concision
Open-Mindedness
Picking the Right Medium

text: You are a project manager for a software development project. You have completed project planning and started project executing. You discover that a stakeholder always comes to the project team office and asks the team members many questions about the project. What should you do with him?
explanation: The best method is to follow communication management plan. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 389

choices.text: Meet with the stakeholder to understand why he feels the need to communicate with your team members.
Ask the stakeholder to formally address his questions to you.
Tell your team members not to waste their time talking this stakeholder.
Ask the stakeholder to formally address project issues as per the communications management plan.

text: During a project weekly meeting, the project manager displays the project status to the team members. The project SPI = 0.83 and CPI = 0.98. The project team are in a very critical situation, because the project is running behind schedule and there is only two months remaining for the project to be completed as per the contract with the customer. If the project is not delivered on time, they may be subjected to a penalty. He wants to clarify the critical situation, so he raised his voice and spoke loudly with an angry look on his face. What did he do?
explanation: Encoding means that the message is coded into symbols, such as text, sound or some other medium for transmission. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 371

choices.text: Decoding
Encoding
Feedback
Acknowledge

text: You are the project manager of an industrial design project that has teams distributed in four countries Spain, India, France and Germany. You want all team members get the right message, so you translate the project plan into Spanish, Hindi, French, and German. Which of the following best describes what you do when you have your communications translated?
explanation: Encoding means that thoughts or ideas are translated (encoded) into language by the sender. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 371

choices.text: Encoding
Decoding
Feedback
Effective listening

text: Vicky through an instant messenger software. Michael is worried that Vicky might misunderstand him and think that he is angry. So, he added a smiley emotion to clarify that he is not angry. What did Michael do?
explanation: Encoding means that the message is coded into symbols, such as text, sound or some other medium for transmission. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 371

choices.text: Decoding
Encoding
Feedback
Acknowledge

text: Karim has been hired as a team member in a large construction project. His native language is Arabic and the organization's language is English. He is having trouble understanding the emails received every day. To overcome this problem, he installed an instant translation software on his phone to translate any received email to Arabic to be able to understand these emails. What did he do?
explanation: Decoding means that the data received is translated by the receiver back into a form useful to the receiver. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 371

choices.text: Decoding
Encoding
Feedback
Acknowledge

text: You are a project manager for a large tele-communication project. The project has 1250 stakeholders. You feel that misunderstandings can occur in your project because the project is a large one and contains a large number of stakeholders. You need to avoid these misunderstandings. What can you use to reduce the number of such misunderstandings?
explanation: Influence and delegating are leadership tools. Collaboration and compromise are conflict resolution techniques. Weekly meeting with 1250 stakeholders will not be effective. But common understanding and communications management can reduce misunderstanding. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 362

choices.text: Common understanding and communications management
A weekly meeting for all stakeholders
Collaboration and compromise
Influence and delegating

text: The project manager assigned Mark to send a weekly email to the project key stakeholders to explain the status of the project. Some stakeholders informed the project manager that they don't receive this email. The project manager wants to know if this email is delivered to these stakeholders or not. He asked Mark to use the option of requesting a delivery receipt from the email software which they use. Mark did what was requested from him and received notifications with who received this email. What did Mark receive?
explanation: Acknowledge means upon receipt of a message, the receiver may signal (acknowledge) receipt of the message, but this does not necessarily mean agreement with or comprehension of the message—merely that it has been received. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 373

choices.text: Feedback
Acknowledge
Noise
Response

text: Mary, the project manager, sent a text message to Tom, a project stakeholder, using the company's instant messaging system. When he received it, Tom called her back. Which of the following is true about this situation?
explanation: Encoding mean that thoughts or ideas are translated (encoded) into language by the sender. Decoding means that the message is translated by the receiver back into meaningful thoughts or ideas. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 371

choices.text: Mary encoded the text message; Tom decoded it, and then encoded his feedback message.
Mary decoded her text message; Tom encoded his phone call and decoded the feedback.
Tom sent feedback to Mary, who encoded it.
Mary decoded her text message and Tom encoded his feedback.

text: You are a project manager for a four phases mechanical project. You finally produced the deliverable of the first phase and have just delivered it to your customer for acceptance. The customer called you to inform you that some features they were expecting are missing. What's the first thing you should do?
explanation: You must first understand what's the problem. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 164 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 83

choices.text: Submit a change request to the project management plan to add the missing features.
Inform the customer that the deliverable has been verified in the Control Quality process.
Apologize to the customer and tell your team to start building missing features.
Meet with the customer to understand the missing features.

text: Catherine is managing a project to author a book about using earned value management in construction projects. She asked Maria, a technical writer, to help her in this project. Maria advised her to pay attentions to the following points: using correct grammar and spelling, using concise expressions and eliminating excess words, having clear purpose, using markers such as introduction and summaries of the ideas, and controlling flow of words and ideas using graphics. Which techniques did Maria advised Catherine to use?
explanation: The 5Cs of written communications involves using correct grammar and spelling, concise expression and elimination of excess words, clear purpose and expression directed to the needs of the reader, coherent logical flow of ideas and controlling flow of words and ideas. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 363

choices.text: Interactive Communication
Cultural Awareness
5C's
Data Representation

text: You are managing a software project. One of your team members informed you that he has added an extra functionality in the work package assigned to him which will help make the usage of the product easier for the customer. The customer didn't require to add this functionality, but it seems that it will make the usage of the product easier. The team member added this functionality to exceed customer expectation. What should you do first in this situation?
explanation: You must first understand the added functionality before taking any decision. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 164 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 87

choices.text: Understand what is the added functionality.
Instruct the team member to remove the added functionality.
Submit a change request to add the new functionality to the scope baseline and calculate the time and cost needed for it.
Reprimand the team member for adding extra functionality.

text: Fredric is a project manager in a multinational company. He is having a phone call with Fernando, a team member working on his project. The English accent of Fernando is very difficult to be understood by Fredric. Fernando's accent is considered as:
explanation: Language barrier is considered to be a noise, which includes any interference or barriers that might compromise the delivery of the message. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 373

choices.text: Noise
Medium
Feedback
Encoding

text: You are managing a product development project. During the project, the customer told you that there are three work packages, he thinks that they are not necessary. The customer doesn't have technical understanding of the project work and he wants to remove these work packages from the project scope. You can't remove these work packages, because if they are removed, the project scope will be negatively impacted. You requested a meeting with the customer and made a presentation about the importance of these work packages. Which process did you undergo?
explanation: A presentation is the formal delivery of information and/or documentation. It can include specific information aimed at increasing understanding and support of the work and objectives of the project. Presentation is a communication skill which can be used in the Manage Communications process. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 384

choices.text: Control Scope
Validate Scope
Perform Integrated Change Control
Manage Communications

text: James is a project team member. He is attending a project weekly status meeting. The project manager is explaining the project status to all the attendees in the meeting. James is moving his head to express his understanding to what the project manager said. What did James do?
explanation: Acknowledge means upon receipt of a message, the receiver may signal (acknowledge) receipt of the message, but this does not necessarily mean agreement with or comprehension of the message—merely that it has been received. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 373

choices.text: Decoding
Encoding
Feedback
Acknowledge

text: The fourth principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: "Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project". Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: Information radiators help keep everyone informed and foster collaboration between business people and developers. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 50

choices.text: Minimum viable product (MVP)
Definition of ready
Backlog preparation
Information radiators

text: Which of the following is an example of noise?
explanation: Noise includes any interference or barriers that might compromise the delivery of the message. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 373

choices.text: An email that's sent to the wrong person.
A project manager who doesn't notice an important clause in a contract.
Garbled text and smudges that make a fax of a photocopy hard to read.
When the team is not paying attention during a phone call.

text: A project team member sent a confidential information to a third party by mistake. The project manager is very angry and he insists on punishing the team member. What could have prevented this situation?
explanation: The communications management plan contains which information should be sent to which stakeholder. If the communications management plan is not proper, it may lead to miscommunications. Monitoring project communications would not prevent the problem, it would discover the problem. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377

choices.text: Reviewing the stakeholder engagement plan
Reviewing the communications management plan
Monitoring project communications
Reviewing the resources management plan

text: A key stakeholder has expressed his concerns about the status reports sent from the project team. He said that he is struggling to obtain the needed information about the project status as the report is overstuffed with unnecessary information. Which of the following is the best course of action for the project manager?
explanation: Reports communicate relevant (usually summary level) information to stakeholders. Often reports are given to stakeholders who are interested in the project status, such as sponsors, business owners, or PMOs. They should be tailored to meet the stakeholders needs. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 385 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 190

choices.text: Inform the stakeholder that the format of the status report has been agreed upon in the communication management plan. If he wants to change it, he can raise a change request.
Ask the stakeholder about his information needs and include them in the status report.
Inform the stakeholder that the status report addresses different stakeholders' needs. It is not tailored according to this particular stakeholder's needs only.
Send a separate report to this particular stakeholder tailored according to his needs.

text: Martin is a project manager for a large construction project. He is having difficulties in keeping the project schedule on track. The project is budgeted at $3,000,000, and has 310 human resources. The project duration is three months and has 380 activities. There are 90 activities on the critical path. The project SPI is 0.78 and CPI is 1.09. Under these circumstances. What should the monthly status report contain?
explanation: Status report contains the status of the project in accordance to the project management plan and possible options. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 385 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 190

choices.text: That the project will need more resources.
The issues and options.
That the project is doing well.
That the project will finish after the required completion date.

text: Nathalie is managing a product development project. During the last project status meeting, she displayed the earned value measurements to the project team and project sponsor. SPI = 1.09 and CPI = 0.79. It is clear that the project is running over budget. The project sponsor is very angry and requested from her to share with him the cost incurred on a weekly basis. Which process should she undergo to provide the needed information to the project sponsor?
explanation: Project communications artifacts may include cost incurred. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 387

choices.text: Control Costs
Determine Budget
Estimate Costs
Manage Communications

text: After the weekly project status meeting with the project team members, you asked a project team member to send minutes of meeting to all the attendees. Meeting minutes is classified as:
explanation: Formal Communication includes reports, formal meetings (both regular and ad hoc), meeting agendas and minutes, stakeholder briefings, and presentations. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Formal Communication
Informal Communication
External Communication
Oral Communication

text: Which of the following projects needs to communicate evolving and emerging details more frequently and quickly than other projects?
explanation: Generally projects that subject to various elements of ambiguity and change like projects that adopt agile life cycles have an inherent need to communicate evolving and emerging details more frequently and quickly. In this question the IT project with not clear scope where the detailed scope is defined and approved before the start of each iteration adopts adaptive or agile life cycle. Other mentioned projects are all examples of projects with predictive life cycles. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 365

choices.text: An IT project with not clear scope, as the detailed scope is defined and approved before the start of each iteration.
A construction project where scope, time, and cost are determined in the early phases of the project life cycle.
A tele-communications project with predictive life cycle and has 550 stakeholders.
An industrial project where changes to the scope are carefully managed.

text: All of the following are examples of non-verbal communication except:
explanation: Examples of nonverbal communication include appropriate body language to transmit meaning through gestures, tone of voice, and facial expressions. Mirroring and eye contact are also important techniques. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 384 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: A project manager is waving his hands to a team member to welcome him.
A trainer is looking at the eyes of his trainees to know if they understand what he said or not.
A team leader advising a team member about how to use non-verbal communication.
A team leader is using an angry look to a team member who came to work late.

text: Due to external factors, a project has been terminated early. The project manager sends the final project report to project stakeholders when a functional manager requests a copy of the report. What should the project manager do in this situation?
explanation: The communications management plan contains which information should be sent to which stakeholder. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 186

choices.text: Ask the functional manager why he needs the report.
Don't send the report and inform his manager.
Send the report.
Consult the communication management plan.

text: All of the following are included in the project communications management plan, except:
explanation: Contact details of each stakeholder are included in the stakeholder register. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377 and 514 and and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 186

choices.text: Guidelines and templates for project status meetings
The use of a project website and project management software
Contact details of each stakeholder
Resources allocated for communication activities, including time and budget

text: What is the purpose of the communications management plan?
explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 79 and 186

choices.text: The project management plan is a subsidiary plan of the overall communications management plan.
The communications management plan describes why you need to communicate with each stakeholders.
The communications management plan describes the information delivery needs including format and level of detail.
The communications management plan focuses on the use of communications technologies by the project management team.

text: The project sponsor has asked the project team to increase the frequency of sending the project status report instead of weekly to be daily. Moreover, he has asked also to send a daily report for the progress of outstanding tasks. The team objects to the sponsor's request because preparing such report takes much time. Which of the following is the best course of action for the project manager?
explanation: The project manager should review the communication management plan which describes the type, frequency and responsible person for sending each report. If it needs to be changed, it must be done through a change request as it is a part of the project management plan. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 79 and 186

choices.text: Ask the sponsor to hire additional resources.
Try to convince both sides to accept sending the report twice a week.
Review the communication management plan and submit a change request if needed.
Meet with the project sponsor and convince him that this is too much work for the team members to do.

text: Which of the following is the purpose of project status meetings?
explanation: The project status meeting is the best method to discuss the status of the project and exchange information about the project. Other choices can be done outside project status meeting. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 376 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 180

choices.text: Exchange information about the project.
Approving project changes.
Have team members report on what they are doing.
Issue project status reports.

text: Frank is managing a major construction project valued at $ 30,000,000. The project SPI is 1.01and CPI is 0.99. The sponsor called him to express concern about the project. He is worried because the project end date is after two weeks. He doesn’t know the status of the project. Frank informed him that his team sends a weekly status report by email. He told him that he doesn't prefer emails because he receives more than 500 emails per day. He doesn't check all emails and he prefers verbal updates. This situation indicates a problem in which project management process?
explanation: The Plan Communication Management process includes determining the stakeholders communication requirements which includes the preferred communication method for each stakeholder. When he informed the project sponsor that his team sends weekly project status report via email, so they are following the communication management plan. So the communication management plan doesn't reflect stakeholders communication requirements. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377

choices.text: Monitor Communications
Plan Communications Management
Manage Stakeholder Engagement
Manage Communications

text: Which of the following statements is true regarding project communications in projects with adaptive life cycle?
explanation: Project environments subject to various elements of ambiguity and change have an inherent need to communicate evolving and emerging details more frequently and quickly. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 365

choices.text: Projects with predictive life cycle have an inherent need to communicate evolving and emerging details more frequently and quickly than projects with iterative or incremental life cycle.
Projects with predictive life cycle have an inherent need to communicate evolving and emerging details more frequently and quickly than projects with adaptive life cycle.
There is no difference between communication in projects with adaptive life cycle and communication in projects with predictive life cycle.
Projects with adaptive life cycle have an inherent need to communicate evolving and emerging details more frequently and quickly than projects with predictive life cycle.

text: During developing the communication management plan for your software project, a team member asks you whether social media can be included as a communication tool to the project communication strategy. What would be your answer?
explanation: The standard communication strategy for project stakeholder communications embraces and selects from all technologies and respects cultural, practical, and personal preferences for language, media, content, and delivery. When appropriate, social media and other advanced computing technologies may be included. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 364

choices.text: Yes, social media can be included in the communication strategy because everyone is using social media in communication.
Yes, social media can be included in the communication strategy with respect to cultural, practical, and personal preferences for language, media, content, and delivery.
No, social media can't be included in the communication strategy because it is informal communication. You must select a formal communication tool.
No, social media can't be included in the communication strategy because it is not available in some countries.

text: A project is being implemented as part of a large program. During project executing, the program manager informs the project manager that due to an organizational change, his project will be terminated. The project manager wants to inform the project stakeholders and project team about project closure. Which document should he refer to?
explanation: An effective communications management plan recognizes the diverse information needs of the project’s stakeholders. It includes stakeholder communication requirements, information to be communicated, including language, format, content, and level of detail..etc. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 186

choices.text: Communication Management Plan
Stakeholder Engagement Plan
Project Closure Guidelines
Change Management Plan

text: Communication barriers can cause miscommunications, it may influence communication when sending or receiving information. Which of the following is not a barrier?
explanation: Feedback is a tool for improving communication not a barrier. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 373

choices.text: Prejudices and Hostility
Distance
Culture and Language
Feedback

text: If the project is facing chaos, which of the following leadership styles is most appropriate in this case?
explanation: In moments of chaos, directive action creates more clarity and momentum than collaborative problem solving. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Directive
Participative
Assertive
Supportive

text: A Scrum Master is working on a critical task when a team member approached him for help. What should the Scrum Master do?
explanation: Scrum Master's main duties are coaching and guiding the team as he is a servant leader. Scrum master duties always come first - before any other task he is working on. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: First complete the critical task then help the team member.
First help the team member then complete the critical task.
Complete the critical task and ask another senior team member to help the team member.
Ask the team member to refer to the product owner.

text: A project team has just been formed to work on a new software project. Which of the following is the most appropriate leadership style for the project manager at this stage in the project?
explanation: Early in a team's formation, the role of the team leader is to directly help with project activities and present a clear, tactical picture of what needs to be done. So the directing leadership style is more directive than supportive. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Directing
Supporting
Coaching
Delegating

text: Carolyne is managing a large project to design a high-efficiency solar cell. The project is very complex and has been running for 18 months. Dan is a team member who has been working very hard and has consistently shown great performance during the project. Carolyne wants to recognize Dan's performance. What should she do?
explanation: People are motivated when they feel they are valued in the organization and this value is demonstrated by the rewards given to them. Generally, money is viewed as a tangible aspect of any reward system, but intangible rewards could be equally or even more effective.

choices.text: Provide a reward that aligns with his personal goals.
Provide a certificate of appreciation in the next team meeting.
Send him a thanks email and keep his functional manager in copy.
Ask his functional manager to approve a bonus for him.

text: James is the project manager of a software project. Midway through his project, he realizes that there’s a problem with a part of the software code and his team members are going to redo this part of the code. One of his team members suggests that the problem is not severe enough to cause all of that re-work. James says that he’s worked on a project that made the same mistake before and they ended up having to redo the work when inspectors discovered it. He convinces the team member that it’s probably better to fix it now than later. What kind of power is he using to make the decision in this situation?
explanation: James is using expert power. Since he’s been through this problem before. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Formal
Expert
Referent
Reward

text: A new project has started in an organization using adaptive approach. Few weeks later, It has been noticed that team performance has decreased because team energy is put into unproductive activities like unnecessary conflicts, many disagreements, clashes and harsh dialogues between team members. Which of the following is the best leadership style for the team coach at this stage?
explanation: As the team passes into the storming phase, there will generally be plenty of disagreement, open conflict, and harsh dialogue. During this stage, the leader needs to assume the coaching style to help team members resolve conflicts without damaging relationships. So the coaching leadership style should provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition.

choices.text: Directing
Supporting
Coaching
Delegating

text: Midway during a sprint, the customer representative keeps calling the development team asking them to add a key feature to the current sprint. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: The scrum master/agile coach is a servant leader who has the skills of facilitation, coaching, and impediment removal. He is also responsible for ensuring that scrum methodology is being followed and applied effectively and he keeps the team and stakeholders focused on learning and using agile processes. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: The development team should escalate this issue to the product owner.
The agile coach should talk to the customer representative and explain how agile projects work.
The team should ask the customer representative not to disturb them anymore during the sprint.
The team should reject the customer request for adding any new features during the sprint.

text: A project manager is leading a large project for electrical system implementation. The project has a large team consisting of people from many functional areas of the company. What is the best power to get cooperation of the team?
explanation: Rewards bring the team's objectives in line with project. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Referent
Penalty
Reward
Formal

text: A project team has been formed to work on a software project which has just been initiated. It is the first time for this team to work together. Which of the following is the best way to lead this team in this stage of the project?
explanation: Early in a team's formation, the role of the team leader is to directly help with project activities and present a clear, tactical picture of what needs to be done. So the directing leadership style is more directive than supportive. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: Everybody in the company does what Paul says, because they all know that he is a close friend to the CEO of the company. What kind of power does he hold over the team?
explanation: Everybody in the company does what Paul says not because his power or his authority but because of his relationship with the CEO. The power used here is referent power. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Legitimate
Reward
Punishment
Referent

text: An agile team has committed to deliver 50 story points during the running iteration. Midway through the iteration one team member becomes sick and must have rest for the remaining time of the iteration. A team member suggests that the team can work overtime to complete the committed story points in the iteration. The team leader should inform him that his suggestion contradicts with which agile principle?
explanation: Agile methods recognize the value of a sustainable pace that allows team members to maintain a work-life balance. A sustainable pace is not only better for the team; it benefits the organization as well. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 8

choices.text: At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly.
The best architectures, requirements, and designs emerge from self-organizing teams.
Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely.
Simplicity—the art of maximizing the amount of work not done—is essential.

text: In high-performing projects, who should exhibit effective leadership skills?
explanation: Leadership is not exclusive to any specific role. High-performing projects may feature multiple people exhibiting effective leadership skills, for example, the project manager, sponsors, stakeholders, senior management, or even project team members. Anyone working on a project can demonstrate effective leadership traits, styles, and skills to help the project team perform and deliver.

choices.text: Project Manager
Project Sponsor
Senior Management
Anyone

text: Peter is currently managing a large software project. His project is currently facing chaos. He decides to use directive leadership. What would be the reason behind using this leadership style?
explanation: In moments of chaos, directive action creates more clarity and momentum than collaborative problem solving. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Because in moments of chaos, directive action creates more participation than any other leadership style.
Because this leadership style elicits more productivity than any other leadership style.
Because this might be the only leadership style he has experience with.
Because in moments of chaos, directive action creates more clarity and momentum than collaborative problem solving.

text: XYZ organization executives have assigned Harry to form a project team to deliver a software to a client. Harry has formed the project team and motivated them towards achieving the project goal and influenced them to align their individual interests in favor of collective effort, and achieve success as a project team rather than as individuals. The organization used ______ while Harry used ______.
explanation: The organization exercised authority by assigning Harry to form the team, while Harry demonstrated leadership by motivating and influencing the team to align their interests toward collective success. Domain = People.

choices.text: Stewardship, responsibility
Responsibility, stewardship
Authority, leadership
Leadership, authority

text: Rebecca is a scrum master working on a large software project. The product owner assigned to the project is always very busy, as he has some other work assigned to him within the organization. As a result, the product owner spends very little time with the team which causes a lot of troubles. What should Rebecca do?
explanation: The product owner needs to participate in scrum events as he is a customer representative. He must be involved to ensure the project success. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: Coach the product owner on the importance of participating in scrum events.
Request another product owner and distribute the work between them.
Escalate the product owner to the project sponsor.
Take the product owner responsibilities during his absence.

text: Helena is a team member who has recently joined a running construction project. She noticed that there is a difference between leadership styles of Kevin, the project manager of the current project and Andrea the project manager of her previous project. Kevin always focuses on goals and achievements, while Andrea focuses on team members learning, development and relationships. What leadership styles do they adopt?
explanation: Transactional style focuses on goals, feedback, and accomplishment, while servant leader style focuses on other people’s growth, learning, development, autonomy, and well-being; concentrates on relationships, community and collaboration. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 65 and The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Kevin adopts transactional style, while Andrea adopts charismatic style.
Kevin adopts transformational style, while Andrea adopts servant leader style.
Kevin adopts transactional style, while Andrea adopts servant leader style.
Kevin adopts laissez-faire style, while Andrea adopts interactive style.

text: A project team has been formed to work on a product development project. It is the first time for this team to work together. After few weeks, while the team members figure out how to work together, some conflict and struggle happened between the team members. Which of the following is the best leadership style to lead a team in this stage of the project?
explanation: As the team passes into the storming phase, there will generally be plenty of disagreement, open conflict, and harsh dialogue. During this stage, the leader needs to assume the coaching style to help team members resolve conflicts without damaging relationships. So the coaching leadership style should provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition.

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: Phil has been assigned to manage a new network installation project. The project team is formed from highly competent and engaged staff within the organization. Which of the following is the best leadership style to use in this situation?
explanation: For environments with highly competent and engaged staff, empowered delegation elicits more productivity than centralized coordination. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Laissez-faire
Directive
Empowered delegation
Autocratic

text: A project manager wants to follow Herzberg's theory of motivation, all of the following are motivating agents that she should follow except:
explanation: Salary is a hygiene factor. Poor hygiene factors may destroy motivation, however improving hygiene factors may not improve motivation. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: Recognition
Responsibility
Self-actualization
Salary

text: Fatima is a scrum master for a software project. During the first sprint, she notices that some developers are not engaged during the daily scrum. The developers usually don't participate and sometimes they check their cell phones during the daily scrum. How can she address this issue?
explanation: The role of the scrum master is to help everyone understand scrum theory and practice. She should coach the team about the importance of the daily scrum and the importance of their participation. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: Instruct the team about the importance of the daily scrum.
Decrease the frequency of the daily scrum to be twice per week instead of once per day.
Bring this issue as an impediment during the next daily scrum.
Discuss the issue in the next retrospective.

text: Mark is a project manager on a software project. He is always watching his team members during their work, during their breaks, and when they leave. He always walks around the office to make sure that everyone is doing his work. He always makes all the project decisions. What kind of manager is he?
