explanation: According to Mc Gregor theory, X manager is always watching his team members, doesn't trust them and believes that they may avoid work whenever possible. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Theory X
Theory Y
Motivating
Effective

text: What should the scrum master do in the daily standups?
explanation: In a daily standup, the scrum master's role is to listen and record any obstacles to the team's progress for immediate follow up. The team is self organized and the discussion is run by the team for the team, so there is no need for facilitator or someone to resolve their conflicts. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 53 and 54

choices.text: Facilitate and control the meeting.
Ask the team about the root cause of their problems.
Resolve team conflict.
Listen and note any problems for follow-up.

text: The project manager says to the team member: "You need to listen to me because I have been put in charge. Perform the work assigned to you". Which power is the project manager using?
explanation: The project manager here is using the power derived from his position (formal or legitimate). Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Legitimate
Situational
Charismatic
Punitive

text: Midway through the project and after many clashes between the team members, it has been noticed that the team members started to adjust their work habits and behaviors and a sense of cohesion and unity has started to emerge between team members. At this stage, what is the most appropriate leadership style?
explanation: When the team reaches the norming phase, the members have successfully created rules (team norms) to help govern themselves. This doesn’t mean the team leader can simply go into cruise control mode, however. Instead, the leader needs to play a supporting role. The team will still need help with conflict resolution, as well as reminders to enforce the norms they have created.

choices.text: Directing
Supporting
Coaching
Delegating

text: You are leading a project team for the fourth project they work on together. As the team members have worked together before on many projects, consensus and cooperation have been well-established and the team is mature, organized, and well-functioning. What is the most appropriate leadership style you can use?
explanation: Performing teams are autonomous, empowered, self-managing, and self-policing. They require little more than to be pointed in the right direction and given regular recognition and appreciation for their high performance. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Directing
Supporting
Coaching
Delegating

text: Adam has been assigned as a project manager for a software project as a replacement for another project manager. The project team consists of 12 members with different skills and experience and each has an action plan for personal development. He wants to adapt his leadership style to support team members according to their action plans for personal development. Which of the following models can help him in this situation?
explanation: The OSCAR coaching and mentoring model helps individuals adapt their coaching or leadership styles to support individuals who have an action plan for personal development. The model refers to five contributing factors outcome, situation, choices/consequences, actions and review. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 156

choices.text: ADKAR
OSCAR
Virginia Satir
Cynefin Framework

text: In the middle of a sprint, a team member is out on a sick leave. The sprint is very critical and any delay in the product increment delivery would endanger the sprint goal. The scrum team are working on their full capacity. In light of this, what should the scrum master do?
explanation: It is true that the sprint can not be extended, but doing nothing is not an appropriate solution. Working overtime is against agile manifesto eighth principle which states that the team should maintain sustainable pace. The best solution is to share the team challenge with the stakeholders and the project sponsor. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide

choices.text: Ask the scrum team to work overtime till the team member is back from his sick leave.
Discuss this topic with the sponsor and stakeholders in order to share the team challenge.
Ask the team to redistribute the tasks between them and focus only on the most important features.
Do nothing, the sprint can not be extended.

text: The project manager for the new project notices that the meeting room seats and air conditioner are not good. She turns her attention to influencing the organization to improve the team’s working conditions. Which motivational theory is she following?
explanation: Herzber theory deals with motivating agents and hygiene factors like working conditions, salary and work relationships. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: Maslow’s hierarchy
Expectancy theory
Herzberg
McGregor

text: An organization adopts agile transformation. Some project managers roles will be switched to team facilitators according to the new structure. They will need to enhance servant leadership skills. Which of the following is an example of servant leadership?
explanation: Servant leadership focuses on removing impediments and supporting the team to perform at its best. Doing administrative work for the team is an example of servant leadership. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide

choices.text: Creating the project plan on weekend so as not to disturb the team.
Doing the administrative work for the team.
Posting the project Gantt chart on the office wall.
Handing out detailed task lists to the team.

text: What is the personality trait of a person who has the ability to perceive the information presented by others and to manage them?
explanation: Emotional character has the ability to perceive emotions and the information they present and to manage them; measure of interpersonal skills. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 66

choices.text: Managerial
Political
Emotional
Social

text: You are a project manager for a new project in a weak matrix organization. The project team formally don’t report to you and you don’t have authority to reward them for their performance. The project is very difficult and has aggressive schedule and tight date constraints. The project requires a high quality standard. Based on these circumstances, what is the most effective power for the project manager will be likely to use?
explanation: The project manager works in a weak matrix organization, so all the powers derived from his position will not be effective like reward, penalty or formal powers. The only power he can use here is the expert power. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Reward
Penalty
Formal
Expert

text: A three phases project adopts a hybrid development approach. The first phase is hardware development adopts a traditional approach. The second phase is software development adopts an adaptive approach. The third phase is systems integration adopts an adaptive approach. The first phase has come to an end. The project manager and the project team are ready to start the second phase. Accordingly some roles and responsibilities will change. Which of the following responsibilities will be changed for the project manager?
explanation: The project manager's role with a predictive phase is more directive and controlling, whereas agile leadership requires servant leadership. Agile teams are considered self-organizing. The team will plan and control the project work. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Detailed work planning, product delivery and team management will be delegated to the project team.
Planning the project work through Kanban board instead of Gantt chart.
Act as a servant leader helping the team sizing the user stories and calculating the team's velocity.
Act as a team facilitator by helping the team to assign user stories according to the team members' skills.

text: A project team is working on a mechanical project. It is the fifth project that this team is working on. The team members have developed a synergy due to working together on many projects, the best leadership style to lead this team is to:
explanation: Performing teams are autonomous, empowered, self-managing, and self-policing. They require little more than to be pointed in the right direction and given regular recognition and appreciation for their high performance. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: Which of the following is among the scrum master's roles during the daily scrum?
explanation: The daily scrum is conducted by the team for the team. The scrum master is a coach, he teaches the developers to keep the daily scrum within the 15 minutes timebox. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: Teach the developers to keep the daily scrum within the 15 minutes timebox.
Facilitate the discussion to ensure that each team member has a chance to speak.
Ensure that each developer has answered the three questions.
Lead the discussion and intervene when needed.

text: Which of the following statements represents guilt-based power?
explanation: Imposition of obligation or sense of duty are examples of using guilt-based. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: You must do what I say because I'm the project manager and I'm accountable on project success.
If you don't achieve your target, you will not get the annual bonus.
You must comply with HR rules and come to work on time.
If you face this type of problems in your work, solve it like this, I have been solving this type of problems the same way over the last three years and never failed.

text: A project is being implemented using adaptive approach. Midway through the project, a quality issue has been discovered that prevents releasing a key deliverable to the customer. The product owner wants to analyze the root cause of the issue. In light of this, what should the team facilitator do?
explanation: The team facilitator is a servant leader. He needs to guide the team members and help them implement the agreed solution. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Coach the team members on how to reach consensus on proposed solutions.
Let the team members decide what to do as they are self organized.
Facilitate a meeting with relevant stakeholders to collect more ideas.
Discuss analyzing the root cause with the team and implement the agreed solution.

text: What is meant by self-organizing teams?
explanation: The self-organizing team, where the team functions with an absence of centralized control. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 310 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 249

choices.text: The team consists of subject matter experts.
The team functions without a team leader.
The team functions without conflicts between team members.
The team functions with an absence of centralized control.

text: Midway during an iteration, one of the project team members informs the project leader that his computer is not connected to the company intranet. What should the project leader do?
explanation: The project leader is a team facilitator and a servant leader. Servant leaders work to fulfill the needs of the teams, projects, and organization. Servant leader focuses on paving the way for the team to do its best work. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 36

choices.text: The team is cross functional, ask another team member who may have IT experience to step in and fix the issue.
Facilitate a resolution with IT department.
The team is self organized, the team member should try to resolve the issue by himself or contact IT department.
Update the issue log and develop a resolution plan.

text: Victor is a project manager working on a project to create a mobile application for a customer. The project team consists of 10 experienced developers who thrive on autonomy. The team has low morale and feel demotivated. What can Victor do to tackle this issue?
explanation: Project team members who thrive on autonomy will perform better if they can establish their own ways of working and even their own work hours and cadence. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 25

choices.text: Request a salary increase for the team.
Stretch the team goals.
Form dynamic working group for demotivated team members.
Let the team establish their own ways of working.

text: Those who act responsibly to carry out activities with integrity, care, and trustworthiness while maintaining compliance with internal and external guidelines are known as:
explanation: Stewards act responsibly to carry out activities with integrity, care, and trustworthiness while maintaining compliance with internal and external guidelines. They demonstrate a broad commitment to financial, social, and environmental impacts of the projects they support. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 24

choices.text: Stewards
Servant Leaders
Project Managers
Scrum Masters

text: The daily standup usually takes more than 15 minutes because the product owner takes some time distributing tasks to the team members. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: The team is self-managed and self-organized. So, tasks are self-assigned by the team. The daily standup is for the team and by the team. There is no need for the product owner to attend the daily standup. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 53

choices.text: The scrum master should distribute tasks to team member after the daily standup.
Extend the daily standup to 30 minutes.
The scrum master should distribute tasks to team member before the daily standup.
The scrum master should ask the product owner not to attend the daily standup and not to distribute tasks to team members.

text: XYZ organization has initiated a new software project. The new project will adopt an adaptive development approach. Resources are being carefully selected for this project because this project is for a new customer and expected to be in a long-term partnership with this customer. Which of the following types of resources will be suitable for this project?
explanation: Successful agile teams are made up of generalizing specialists, or “T-shaped” people. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 42

choices.text: People with deep specialization in one area.
Distributed work teams.
I-shaped
T-shaped

text: Bruce is a project manager for an industrial project. This is the first project he manages. He expects to face some difficulties with team members and stakeholders because he usually accepts others for what and who they are and always shows open concern. He is worried that his personality characteristics may affect managing the team members and achieving project objectives. What is his personality trait?
explanation: Authentic personality accepts others for what and who they are, show open concern. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 66

choices.text: Authentic
Courteous
Emotional
Social

text: Which of the following is the correct pairing of leadership styles and team phases in Tuckman model of team formation and development progress?
explanation: When the team is in the forming stage, the role of the team leader is to directly help with project activities and present a clear, tactical picture of what needs to be done. So the directing leadership style is more directive than supportive. As the team passes into the storming phase, there will generally be plenty of disagreement, open conflict, and harsh dialogue. During this stage, the leader needs to assume the coaching style to help team members resolve conflicts without damaging relationships. When the team reaches the norming phase, the members have successfully created rules (team norms) to help govern themselves. Performing teams are autonomous, empowered, self-managing, and self-policing.

choices.text: Directing and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Supporting and Norming, Delegating and Performing
Directing and Forming, Supporting and Storming, Coaching and Norming, Delegating and Performing
Directing and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Delegating and Norming, Supporting and Performing
Supporting and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Directing and Norming, Delegating and Performing

text: Michael is managing an accounting software project. He finds that bringing all of his team members together into a single room to work increases their communication, and decreases misunderstandings. This is referred to as a:
explanation: Colocation involves placing many or all of the most active project team members in the same physical location to enhance their ability to perform as a team. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 340

choices.text: Colocation
Virtual team
Team building activities
Conflict resolution techniques

text: After the newly formed project team has gone through many conflicts between the team members, the project team starts to function as a collective body. Team members know their places on the team and how they relate to and interface with all the other members. They are starting to work together. What is the best leadership style to lead a team at this stage?
explanation: When the team reaches the norming phase, the members have successfully created rules (team norms) to help govern themselves. This doesn’t mean the team leader can simply go into cruise control mode, however. Instead, the leader needs to play a supporting role. The team will still need help with conflict resolution, as well as reminders to enforce the norms they have created. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 166

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: A product development project has been initiated in XYZ organization, where organization's senior management, project sponsor and project manager attempt to exert project influence in multiple, misaligned directions. Which of the following is most likely to happen?
explanation: More conflict and confusion can emerge when too many participants attempt to exert project influence in multiple, misaligned directions. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: More motivation for project team and stakeholders.
More conflict and confusion can emerge.
More alignment toward project goal.
More commitment to senior management, sponsor and project manager directions.

text: During daily standup, a project team member A has mentioned an impediment that the product owner and a lead developer will leave the organization this month. Team member B has mentioned an impediment of delay in required components which will affect product increment delivery. Team member C has mentioned an impediment that the logistics provider contract will expire this week. Team member D has mentioned an impediment that the number of defects found till now is higher than expected. Which impediment should the scrum master focus on first?
explanation: Finding a product owner is the most important impediment for the scrum master to work on. The product owner is responsible for prioritizing the product backlog items and helps the teams see how to deliver the highest value without creating waste. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Finding a product owner.
Asking procurement department to renew the contract with the logistics supplier.
Finding the root cause of the defects.
Finding a replacement for the delayed component.

text: All of the following are not “hygiene factors” under Herzberg’s Motivation-Hygiene Theory except:
explanation: Motivational factors include matters that relate to the content of the work, such as achievement, growth, and advancement. Herzberg also identified hygiene factors related to the work, such as company policies, salary, and the physical environment. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: Recognition for excellent work
Self-actualization
Company policy
Achievements

text: Which of the following is an example of a reward system?
explanation: Reward must be achievable and motivating. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 341 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: The team member who works hardest will receive $1,000.
Everyone will get a bonus of $300 if the project finishes in on time.
All the team members will have a salary raise if the company achieved good revenue.
All the project team members will get 500$ if the product of the project was state-of-the-art.

text: Mike is a project manager for a software project. He is managing a project team which consists of twelve team members. He has noticed that two of his team members are demotivated, Dave who likes relatedness and Noel who likes new challenges. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: A project team member who is motivated by challenge will respond well to stretch goals and problems to solve. A project team member who is motivated by relatedness will respond to being part of a dynamic working group. Tailoring motivation methods based on individual preferences helps to elicit the best individual and project team performance. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 25

choices.text: Mike should let both of them establish their own ways of working.
Mike should apply a motivation method for the team as a whole not per individual.
Mike should assign Dave to be a part of a dynamic group and stretch goals for Noel.
Mike should ask for a motivational bonus for both of them.

text: During iteration planning for an agile project, the team has committed to 50 story points for the coming iteration. However, the product owner wants the team to deliver five more story points which will deliver more value to the customer. The team is uncomfortable committing more as it hasn't understood the stories well. The agile coach is trying to solve the problem, what should she do?
explanation: Adding more details and acceptance criteria will help the team understand the stories better and make an informed decision about their commitment. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide

choices.text: She should inform the product owner that the five more story points will be added to the next iteration.
She should explain to the product owner that the team determines their commitment and he needs to accept what they have identified.
She should ask the product owner to review the stories and add more details and acceptance criteria to help the team better determine if they can deliver more stories.
She should ask the team to increase their velocity and if needed she can ask for more resources.

text: All the project team trust John and do what he says because he showed great performance during the financial crisis which his organization faced last year. Which power does John have on the project team?
explanation: Situational power is gained due to unique situation such as a specific crisis. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Legitimate
Situational
Charismatic
Ingratiating

text: Which of the following leadership styles has proven to be the universally best or recommended approach?
explanation: Documented leadership styles range from autocratic, democratic, laissez-faire, directive, participative, assertive, supportive, and autocratic to consensus. Of all these, no single leadership style has proven to be the universally best or recommended approach. Instead, effective leadership is shown when it best fits a given situation. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Autocratic
Democratic
Laissez-faire
None of them

text: Midway during a sprint, a team member who is working on a critical item informs the team and the scrum master in a daily scrum that he will be on leave due to a family issue for three days. The backlog item which he is working on is very critical as there is a mandatory dependency for this item to be completed in order to start working on some other backlog items. In light of this, what should the scrum master do?
explanation: Reprioritizing the sprint backlog is not a solution as there is a mandatory dependency. The scrum master should ask the team member's functional manager to provide a replacement during his leave. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 39

choices.text: Ask the team member to complete the critical backlog items before going on leave.
Ask the team to reprioritize the sprint backlog.
Request from the team member's functional manager to provide a replacement for the team member during his leave.
Ask the product owner to reprioritize the sprint backlog.

text: The fifth principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: "Build projects around motivated individuals. Give them the environment and support they need, and trust them to get the job done". Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: Having the best people is significantly more important for a project than having the best processes. Agile methods promote empowered teams. People work better when they are given the autonomy to organize and plan their own work. Allowing the team to create their own team charter with team norms and values will help create an agile environment in which team members can perform at their best. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Burndown chart
Release planning
Backlog preparation
Team charter

text: An agile practitioner has been assigned to be a scrum master for a scrum team, what should he do next?
explanation: Each element of the scrum framework serves a specific purpose that is essential to the overall value and results realized with scrum. Changing the core design or ideas of scrum, leaving out elements, or not following the rules of scrum, covers up problems and limits the benefits of scrum, potentially even rendering it useless. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 39

choices.text: Check the latest retrospective findings.
Check the information radiators to know the status of the project.
Start to inspect the team processes to confirm they are aligned with scrum accepted practices.
Start identifying team issues and work with the team to solve them.

text: You are an agile practitioner to be assigned to a new project. There are two teams in the organization who can work on this project. Team A has John a business analyst, Mark a UI designer, Steve a coder and Smith a system tester. They are all experts in their fields. Team B has Mathew and Ann who can both work as business analyst and UI designer as well and Chris and Sandra who can both work as coder and system tester as well. Which team will you prefer to work with and why?
explanation: Generalizing specialists are individuals who have cross-functional skills and can readily move between roles. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 42

choices.text: Team A because team members are generalizing specialists.
Team B because team members are generalizing specialists.
Team A because team members are traditional specialists.
Team B because team members are traditional specialists.

text: Philip is the managing director of a famous fast food restaurants chain. He is facing troubles with delaying customer orders. During the last three months, his company received more than 200 complains from customers due to delayed orders. In order to improve the customers' orders management, he decided to treat each order as a project. The project manager will be responsible for handling customers' orders, ensuring order delivery within pre- determined time, resolving customer issues. The project manager is not required to prepare a plan for each order rather than preparing a daily report for all orders. How would you describe this situation?
explanation: The mentioned work here is operational work not project work. An ongoing work effort is generally a repetitive process that follows an organization’s existing procedures. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 16

choices.text: This is a group of related projects, so these orders are considered as a program.
Each order is a project, so there should be a charter for each project.
This is a portfolio, because all these orders help to achieve the same strategic objective.
This is operational work.

text: A project team has created a software as a project deliverable for a customer. The customer has initiated the project and requested a software solution because they think that the solution resolves the business need for higher productivity. The software which is the output of the project does not enable the productivity outcome that is intended. The project stakeholders feel that the project has failed. Which of the following best represents the root cause of this issue?
explanation: The main issue here is the focus on deliverables not on the intended outcomes. To support value realization from projects, project teams shift focus from deliverables to the intended outcomes. Doing so allows project teams to deliver on the vision or purpose of the project, rather than simply creating a specific deliverable. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 36

choices.text: The project team did not understand the intended outcome from the deliverable.
The project requirements were not collected in details at the beginning of the project.
The project team were not involved from the beginning of the project.
There was a communication gap between the customer and the project team.

text: Sergio is a newly assigned project manager in a construction firm. He has been assigned to establish a PMO in the organization, to provide the projects' team members with required templates, training, access to information and lessons learned. According the mentioned degree of control, the PMO is considered to be:
explanation: Supportive PMOs provide a consultative role to projects by supplying templates, best practices, training, access to information and lessons learned from other projects. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 48

choices.text: Adaptive
Supportive
Controlling
Directive

text: The organization has recently signed a contract with the government of two countries to build a very large bridge linking the two countries crossing a sea. The required work is very large and complex, it is budgeted at 2 billions $ and scheduled to be completed within 3 years. The required work can be best described as:
explanation: Programs are not large projects. A very large project may be referred to as a megaproject. As a guideline, megaprojects cost US$1billion or more, affect 1 million or more people, and run for years. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 10

choices.text: Operational work
Megaproject
Program
Portfolio

text: An organization wants to adopt agile transformation. The organization management board need to include more agile methodologies in the organization's projects. What should be done prior to including agile methodologies in the organization's projects?
explanation: The organization should first assess the organizational culture and readiness to undertake this initiative. This organization change usually takes time and is recommended to be gradually and incrementally not an abrupt change. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Assess the organization's culture and readiness for transformation.
Hire a group of agile coaches.
Provide training for the current employees on agile methodologies.
Pause all current projects because they adopt traditional approach.

text: Which of the following is the top priority for an agile project?
explanation: As per the agile manifesto "Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software". So the top priority is satisfying the customer through delivery of valuable product. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide Page 8

choices.text: Working collaboratively with customer and having a lightweight contract.
Satisfying the customer through delivery of valuable product.
Providing working software and accurate documentation.
Responding to change and following adaptive plan.

text: A project team in a maintenance center is working on repairing computers, but they are having difficulty creating a project charter. What is the best description of the problem?
explanation: The work mentioned here is not a project at all. Maintenance work is operational, ongoing and repetitive work, there is no need to create a project charter. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 16

choices.text: They haven’t identified project objectives.
They haven’t identified the product of the project.
The end date has not been set.
They are working on a process and not on a project.

text: A new project manager has just been assigned a construction project that is ongoing and is three weeks behind schedule. The team members are about to be distributed to another new project based on the original time estimates by the functional manager. What type of organization is the new project manager in?
explanation: There is a little authority for a project manager in a centralized (functional) organization. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Hybrid
Balanced matrix
Centralized
Project-oriented

text: A project is being implemented using a predictive approach. There is a high turnover rate for the project team members. More then 50% of the project team members who were assigned at the beginning of the project have left the project and new team members replaced them. The project manager wants to adopt an adaptive approach to accommodate these changes. If his trial is successful, it can be applied on all projects within the organization. What should the project manager do first?
explanation: Before making any change, the project manager needs to evaluate the benefits and the risks for making this change and take the decision accordingly. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Ask the team members about their knowledge about agile methodologies.
Evaluate the impacts of moving to adaptive approach.
Schedule a training session for the team members about agile methodologies.
Ensure there is a sufficient budget to make this change.

text: Tom is a project manager at training and consulting company. The company regularly builds teams to create products for clients and train them on those products. When the product is delivered, the team is dissolved and assigned to other projects. What kind of organization is he working for?
explanation: In project-oriented organizations, staff are released after project end and achieving project objectives. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Multi-divisional
Project-oriented
Functional
Strong matrix

text: A large project is being initiated in an organization. The project will be associated with large changes which will impact many departments within the organization. All of the following models can be used by the project manager to transition from the current to the future desired state, except:
explanation: Change models include ADKAR, Virginia Satir, transition model and the 8-step process for leading a change. Cynefin model is a complexity model. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 161-164

choices.text: ADKAR
Virginia Satir
Transition Model
Cynefin

text: Tony and Maxim are two project managers in two different organizations. Tony is usually involved in evaluation and analysis activities prior to project initiation which includes consulting with executive and business unit leaders on ideas for advancing strategic objectives and improving organizational performance. While Maxim is always assigned to manage projects in his organization after the project charter is signed. Which of the following statements best describes this situation?
explanation: The role of a project manager may vary from organization to organization. The project management role is tailored to fit the organization. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 51

choices.text: Tony is more experienced than Maxim, so he is included in evaluation and analysis activities prior to project initiation.
Tony's organization is always looking for advancing their strategic objectives and improving their organizational performance, while Maxim's organization don't.
Both Tony and Maxim perform their roles as project manager each one as specified in his organization.
Tony is performing the role of a portfolio manager, while Maxim is performing his role as a project manager.

text: What could be a PMO role in agile transformation?
explanation: The PMO can help the organization stay on the right side of required compliance needs. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide Page 81

choices.text: Providing guidelines to ensure compliance with agile frameworks.
Providing agile tools like Kanban boards and burn charts.
Providing project managers to new agile projects.
Ensuring compliance with standard team velocity.

text: Sam is leading a large project within the organization to switch the manual way of handling customer requests to an automated way. The project is associated with huge changes to organizations systems, employees behaviors and the organization culture as a whole, so it is expected to face a huge resistance from many stakeholders. Which of the following models can he use to transition from the current to the future desired state?
explanation: Many projects contain an aspect of changing systems, behaviors, activities, and sometimes, cultures. Managing this type of change requires thinking about how to transition from the current to the future desired state. There are many models that describe the activities necessary for successful change management like ADKAR model which focuses on five sequential steps that individuals undergo when adapting to change awareness, desire, knowledge, ability and reinforcement.

choices.text: ADKAR
OSCAR
McGregor
Cynefin Framework

text: Due to recent changes in the organization structure, three persons from your project team are going to leave the organization because their positions have become redundant. This has negatively impacted the team members' morale, as the project is progressing well. What should you do as a project manager in this situation?
explanation: The process for leading change for transforming organizations is a top-down approach where the need for and approach to change originates at the top levels of the organization, and then is promoted down through the organization's layers of management to the change recipients. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 162

choices.text: Inform the team members that this is the organization's board decision.
Meet with the project team members to discuss the changes and the reasons why it has been undertaken.
Escalate to the project sponsor and let him know how the organization's decision has negatively impacted your project.
Arrange a farewell party for the released team members.

text: Adam recently joined a leading software organization to initiate a project management office. The PMO should have control on all the projects running in the organization and the project managers should report directly to the PMO because the new PMO will be accountable for project success in the organization. Which type of PMO is being initiated here?
explanation: Directive PMOs take control of the projects by directly managing the projects. Project managers are assigned by and report to the PMO. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 48

choices.text: Supportive
Controlling
Directive
Proactive

text: There was a meeting between IT manager and spare parts manager to discuss a major scope change. Your boss is the IT manager. After the meeting your manager contacts you to complete the paper work needed to make the change. This is an example of:
explanation: Here you are a project expediter, because simply you implement what others decided. You didn't evaluate the change or its impacts. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Management attention to scope management
A project expediter position
A change control system
A configuration management system

text: A project has been initiated within an organization to merge two large departments into one department. There are many side talks between the employees in the two departments affected by the change. Most of them feel anxiety because there will be changes to their usual way of working, working on new systems which they are not familiar with and changing their work locations. Which of the following models can help them understand what they are feeling and enable them to move through change more efficiently?
explanation: Virginia Satir developed a model of how people experience and cope with change. Its purpose is to help project team members understand what they are feeling and enable them to move through change more efficiently. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 163

choices.text: OSCAR
Virginia Satir
Cynefin Framework
Herzberg

text: The project team is undergoing an agile transformation. This requires the team members to maintain their original project plans and project documents in the current management tool, but also enter performance data in the new tool built around agile practices. Which of the following documents the project team members will not map into the new agile tool?
explanation: Requirements documentation will be added and maintained by the product owner to the product backlog. It is the product owner's responsibility not the team. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide, Page 52

choices.text: Project charter
Team charter
Risk register
Requirements documentation

text: All of the following are among the value delivery office (VDO) roles, except:
explanation: The VDO serves an enabling role, rather than a management or oversight function. It focuses on coaching project teams; building adaptive skills and capabilities throughout the organization; and mentoring sponsors and product owners to be more effective in those roles. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 141

choices.text: Providing policies, templates and lessons learned for managing projects within the organization.
Mentoring sponsors and product owners to be more effective in those roles.
Coaching project teams.
Building adaptive skills and capabilities throughout the organization.

text: A large project is being implemented within an organization which entails large organizations changes. Employees in the organization feel confusion, anxiety and frustration. Which of the following models can be used to deal with them psychologically?
explanation: Transition Model provides an understanding of what occurs to individuals psychologically when an organizational change takes place. This model differentiates between change and transition. Change is situational and happens whether or not people transition through it. Transition is a psychological process where people gradually accept the details of the new situation and the changes that come with it. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 164

choices.text: ADKAR
Virginia Satir
The 8-Step Process for Leading Change
Transition Model

text: You are managing a project to develop a new pharmaceutical compound. The project is very difficult and has a tight schedule. A quality auditor came to you to perform a quality audit on your project. Your team is already under pressure to complete the project. They object to the audit due to the work pressure. You should explain to the team that the purpose of a quality audit is:
explanation: The project manager is not authorized to check if the customer is following the quality process. Inspecting the deliverables and prevent defect ones to go to the customer is the focus of Control Quality process. The quality audits are tools of the Perform Quality Assurance process which focus on following processes and procedures. Although ISO 9000 is a quality standard, but it is not the main focus of quality audits. So the best answer is to identify inefficient and ineffective policies. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 294

choices.text: To check if the customer is following the quality process.
To inspect deliverables and prevent defective ones to go to the customer.
To satisfy part of an ISO 9000 investigation.
To identify inefficient and ineffective policies.

text: During the execution of your new product development project, a new quality standard is issued and your project team is holding a meeting with the quality department to determine how the standard will apply to the running project. This is part of which quality management process?
explanation: Team is defining how to meet the new standard, it is part of the Plan Quality Management process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 277

choices.text: Plan Quality Management
Manage Quality
Total Quality Management
Control Quality

text: Catherine is closing her first project, she is collecting lessons learned with project team members and stakeholders. Many stakeholders were not satisfied about the project and they complained that their needs were not fully met. Her boss asks her about the steps she took on her project to improve customer satisfaction. Which subsidiary plan would she consult to determine this information?
explanation: The quality management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how applicable policies, procedures, and guidelines will be implemented to achieve the quality objectives. It describes the activities and resources necessary for the project management team to achieve the quality objectives set for the project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 286 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 186

choices.text: Quality Management Plan
Scope Management Plan
Stakeholders Management Plan
Risk Management Plan

text: A project manager of a manufacturing project is analyzing activities that doesn’t add value to the project and wastes company resources and time. A team member informed him that a process is not understood and another one informed him that two processes he works on, he thinks they are not needed. The project manager must be leading which of the following?
explanation: Manage Quality process is concerned with following and improving processes and increasing its efficiency. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 290

choices.text: Manage Quality
Control Quality
A process rather than a project
Plan Quality Management

text: Samuel is managing a project to develop a new pharmaceutical compound. He noticed that the packing process has many problems, so he held a meeting with his team to examine problems and non-value-added activities that occur during packing process. They also identified many opportunities to improve the process. Which process are they involved in and which tool are they using?
explanation: Process analysis identifies opportunities for process improvements. This analysis also examines problems, constraints, and non-value-added activities that occur during a process.

choices.text: Plan Quality Management, mind mapping
Control Quality, performance reviews
Control Quality, product evaluation
Manage Quality, process analysis

text: Luke is a project manager in a construction company. He was assigned to manage a construction project to build a new shopping center. During performing the strength tests, he found severe failure in the strength tests. He assigned Steve to investigate this problem. Steve started tracking the problem to determine and solve the main reasons behind it. Which tool should Steve use to track the problem?
explanation: Cause-and-effect (Fishbone) diagrams are used to trace the problem's source back to its root cause. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 293

choices.text: Fishbone diagram
Histogram
Design of experiments
Design for X

text: A new medicine has been released in market by a large pharmaceutical company. A serious side effect has been discovered which may cause a sudden decrease in blood pressure. The company has recalled all products from the market. The incurred cost for recalling the medicine is known as:
explanation: Cost of failures found by the customer is considered a cost of non conformance. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 283 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 88

choices.text: Cost of conformance
Cost of non conformance
Cost of prevention
Cost of inspection

text: Catherine is a project manager for a new product development project. After the product of the project has been released, it was found to have numerous features more than any other similar product in the market, but obvious defects have been found by the users of the product. The product is categorized as:
explanation: The high-grade product has numerous features and the low quality product has many defects. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 274

choices.text: High grade, low quality
Low grade, low quality
Low grade, high quality
High grade, high quality

text: Smith is managing a large product development project. The customer of the project has very tight quality tolerance and will not accept any defected product. He has set strict quality control measures and feedback verification loops from a similar previous project. However during scope validation, the customer has rejected a high percentage of the products due to defects found. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: It is clear that in this situation the quality control procedures including verification and feedback loops were taken from a similar project without tailoring. Quality control procedures and quality assurance steps need to be tailored for the specific needs for this project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 151

choices.text: Escalate this topic to the steering committee.
More tailoring for quality control procedures and quality assurance steps.
Demonstrate the quality control measures and feedback verification loops to the customer.
Review the customer's inspection process.

text: The project team is in the design phase of a new car prototype. The team is analyzing which type of motors and wheels would provide a high speed with more safety. Which of the following is the most likely technique would they use to determine these variables?
explanation: Design of experiments helps to determine a group of variables to improve quality. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 290

choices.text: Matrix diagrams
Cost-benefit analysis
Design for X
Design of experiments

text: You are a project manager for a new construction project. Your project is to build a new housing compound which contains 10,000 houses. The houses are substantially similar. What must you do?
explanation: If the project has some repeated activities, the lessons learned of the first few installations can be used to improve the process on the remaining installations. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 289

choices.text: Plan in continuous improvement activities.
Make sure the first and last of these work packages is scheduled close in time to each other.
See what can be done to remove the similarity.
Make sure the same resource completes all the similar work packages.

text: While testing the stability of the electronic board used in your project, you discover that it becomes unstable when it works in high temperature which doesn’t meet your company’s quality standards. You are sure that it will function as it is with the customer, and you don’t think the board needs to meet the quality level specified. What should you do?
explanation: Stating in your reports that the board simply “meets our quality needs” or changing the quality standards to meet the achieved level are against the professional and social responsibility of the project manager. Documenting the problem in lessons learned register maybe done later because it doesn't solve the current problem. So the best solution is to report the lesser quality and try to find a solution. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 299

choices.text: State in your reports that the board simply “meets our quality needs”.
Change the quality standards to meet the achieved level.
Document this problem in lessons learned register and send this board to customer.
Report the lesser quality and try to find a solution.

text: You are in the middle of executing a major new construction project. The project is very important and highly visible in your organization. The sponsor informed you that he is worried that the project will not meet the quality standards it was intended to. If the project doesn't meet the quality standard, the customer will not be satisfied. What should you do in this situation?
explanation: Assuring the sponsor that the project would meet the quality standards is not a solution. Historical information of your past projects don't indicate the status of the current project. The Quality Management Plan doesn't indicate the current situation. Forming a quality assurance team will indicate if the team is following the correct processes and procedures which meets the quality standards and metrics. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 294

choices.text: Assure the sponsor that during the Plan Quality Management process, it was determined that the project would meet the quality standards.
Form a quality assurance team.
Show him the historical information of your past projects that they all met the quality standards.
Check the results from the last quality management plan.

text: Adam is managing an industrial project when one of the project team members informed him that the dimensions of one of the project deliverables are different than the planned dimensions and thus it will be unable to operate with the machine. Adam asked the team member to determine the basic underlying reasons that cause this variance and also to determine whether these reasons might cause other variances in other project deliverables. Which tool should the team member use in this situation?
explanation: Root cause analysis is an analytical technique used to determine the basic underlying reason that causes a variance, defect, or risk. A root cause may underlie more than one variance, defect, or risk. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 292 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 177

choices.text: Audits
Alternatives analysis
Root cause analysis (RCA)
Process analysis

text: Project changes are approved during the _____  process and verified during the______ process.
explanation: Project changes are approved during the Perform Integrated Change Control process and verified during the Control Quality process. Domain = Process PMBOK 6th edition, Page 301

choices.text: Perform Integrated Change Control, Control Quality.
Perform Integrated Change Control, Validate Scope.
Perform Integrated Change Control, Control Scope.
Monitor and Control Project Work, Validate Scope..

text: During planning your project, you are balancing project constraints scope, time, cost, quality,..The customer required that quality of this project must be as high as possible. This type of projects is relatively new to your organization. What is the best thing to do in this situation?
explanation: Benchmarking is not effective here because this type of projects is new. Using Ishikawa diagram or control charts are not proactive solutions. So the best answer is to audit work as it is being completed to look for any needed improvements. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 294

choices.text: Audit work as it is being completed to look for any needed improvements.
Use Ishikawa diagram when there is a defect.
Benchmark the current project quality standards to identify best practices.
Use control charts to make sure that the process is in control.

text: Alex is a project manager working for automobile manufacturer for a project to build more fuel-efficient, high stability small cars. He and his team determine how to inspect the product of the project to meet the stakeholders’ needs and expectations, as well as to meet the goal for the product’s performance and reliability. In which process are they involved and which tool are they using?
explanation: During the planning phase in the Plan Quality Management process, the project manager and the project team determine how to test or inspect the product, deliverable, or service to meet the stakeholders’ needs and expectations, as well as how to meet the goal for the product’s performance and reliability. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 285

choices.text: Manage Quality, Process Analysis
Manage Quality, Audits
Control Quality, Inspection
Plan Quality Management, Test and inspection planning

text: While analyzing the last year performance of the company, it was found that the company has lost many customers especially who used the products of the company during last year. The CEO informed all the project managers to pay more attention to quality management. He focused not just on giving customers products without any defects by keeping the defective ones out of the customer hands, but keeping errors out of the process of producing deliverables. Keeping errors out of the process is known as:
explanation: Prevention means keeping errors out of the process and inspection means keeping errors out of the hands of the customer. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 274

choices.text: Variable sampling
Attribute sampling
Prevention
Inspection

text: Thomas is managing a large project to produce a new pharmaceutical drug. The project is very important for his company and quality has a top priority. Strict quality standards have been put in place and they must be followed. In order to achieve the required quality standard, Thomas approved on a business trip for two team members to have training on the new quality standards. The cost of team members training is an example of:
explanation: Prevention costs are costs related to the prevention of poor quality in the products, deliverables, or services of the specific project. Examples on prevention costs are training and equipment. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 282 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 88

choices.text: Failure costs
Cost of nonconformance
Appraisal cost
Prevention cost

text: A project team adopts extreme programming method (XP) is working on a software project. XP applies the concept of pair programming where the team members are writing software code together as a pair and reviewing each other's work to determine if the code conforms to the requirements documentation or not. What will be a result of these reviews?
explanation: A goal of the Control Quality process is to determine the correctness of deliverables. The results of performing the Control Quality process are verified deliverables that become an input to the Validate Scope process for formalized acceptance. As the two developers inspect each other completed work, so they are doing the same as Control Quality process. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 102 and PMBOK 6th edition, Page 305

choices.text: Product Increment
Minimum Viable Product
Accepted Deliverables
Verified deliverable

text: A new cell phone has been released in markets as a product of a project in a multi-national organization. It seems that some defects have been noticed by customers in the new cell phone. The organization decided to make a survey in all shops to collect data about the defects. The cost regarding defects identified in the surveys may be considered as:
explanation: The cost regarding defects identified in the surveys may be considered external failure costs in the COQ model and can have extensive cost implications for the organization. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 303 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 88

choices.text: Prevention costs
Appraisal costs
Internal failure costs
External failure costs

text: Which of the following statements indicates the optimal cost of quality?
explanation: The optimal COQ is one that reflects the appropriate balance for investing in the cost of prevention and appraisal to avoid failure costs. So costs of conformance should be less than costs of nonconformance. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 282 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 88

choices.text: Appraisal costs should be less than prevention costs.
Costs of conformance should be less than costs of nonconformance.
Prevention costs should be more than external failure costs.
Internal failure costs should be less than prevention costs.

text: Carol is an experienced project manager in her organization. She is managing an IT project using agile approach. A team member asks Carol about the quality control activities when and by whom they will be performed. Which of the following would be her answer?
explanation: In agile projects, the Control Quality activities may be performed by all team members throughout the project life cycle. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 75

choices.text: The Control Quality activities may be performed by all team members towards the end of the project or phase.
The Control Quality activities may be performed by Quality Control team throughout the project life cycle.
The Control Quality activities may be performed by all team members throughout the project life cycle.
The Control Quality activities may be performed by Quality Control team towards the end of the project or phase.

text: Costs of testing and inspections are examples of:
explanation: Appraisal costs are costs related to evaluating, measuring, auditing, and testing the products, deliverables, or services of the specific project like testing and inspection. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 283 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 88

choices.text: Failure costs
Cost of nonconformance
Appraisal cost
Prevention cost

text: William is a project manager in a chemicals industrial company. The PMO in this company has authorized William to manage a project to lessen environmental impacts of one of its products. He found that replacing one type of material used in the product with another new environment friendly material, will decrease environmental impacts. He and his team are studying the consequences of removing the material and using the new material on the product technical properties like quality and price. Which technique should help the team in this situation?
explanation: A scatter diagram is a graph that shows the relationship between two variables. Scatter diagrams can demonstrate a relationship between any element of a process, environment, or activity on one axis and a quality defect on the other axis. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 293 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 189

choices.text: Matrix diagrams
Cause- and- effect diagram
Scatter diagram
Histogram

text: A project manager for a new electronic chips manufacturing project needs to make sure that the deliverables meet the quality standards. The project team produces about 100,000 chips per day, so testing all the deliverables would take much time and cost. The chips are so small that inspection would destroy them. Under these circumstances, what should the project manager do?
explanation: You need to take a valid sample of the products of the project if inspecting the entire population would take much time, or if inspecting the products would be destructive. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 303

choices.text: Inspect a sample of the deliverables.
Outsource the inspection to another company with more expertise.
Test all the deliverables to meet the quality standard.
Form a quality assurance team to audit the manufacturing process.

text: Testing the stability of one of the electronic chips manufactured by your company to determine if it meets your quality standards is an example of:
explanation: Statistical sampling involves choosing part of a population of interest for inspection. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 303

choices.text: Benchmarking
Design of experiments
Statistical sampling
Design for X

text: Andrew is a project manager in an industrial firm. He is taking over a manufacturing project from another project manager who resigned two weeks ago. Previously the company has faced criticism for the project deliverables from the customer. The previous project manager didn't pay much attention to quality of deliverables. Andrew hired inspectors to inspect the product of the project and prevent the defective ones from reaching the customer. He required from the extra inspectors to record the inspection results of the products as either conform or do not conform to quality requirements. This technique is known as:
explanation: Attribute sampling means that the result either conforms or does not conform and variable sampling means that the result is rated on a continuous scale that measures the degree of conformity. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 274

choices.text: Variable sampling
Attribute sampling
Prevention
Statistical sampling

text: Luis is a project manager in an electronics firm. He has been assigned to manage a new project to develop a faster, cheaper, and smaller laptop. He is analyzing the defects found in the product by graphical representation of this numerical data. The graph shows the ranking of the cause of defects and the number of defects found per deliverable. Which data representation technique is he using?
explanation: Histograms show a graphical representation of numerical data. Histograms can show the number of defects per deliverable, a ranking of the cause of defects, the number of times each process is noncompliant, or other representations of project or product defects. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 293

choices.text: Histogram
Scatter Diagram
Matrix diagram
Cause-and-effect diagram

text: A project manager is executing a construction project. He is working with the quality assurance team to ensure that the project will satisfy the quality standards and metrics. Which of the following must they have before they start this process?
explanation: Quality control measurements are used to analyze and evaluate the quality of the processes and deliverables of the project against the standards of the performing organization or the requirements specified. Quality control measurements can also compare the processes used to create the measurements and validate actual measurements to determine their level of correctness. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 288

choices.text: Quality control measurements
Quality assurance plan
Verified deliverables
Quality reports

text: A project manager for a product development project was informed by a team member that a defect was found in a deliverable that must be delivered to customer tomorrow according to the project schedule. The project manager knows that the customer doesn’t have the technical understanding to notice the defect. The deliverable meets the contract requirements, but it doesn’t meet the project manager’s quality standard. What is the best course of action for the project manager?
explanation: Issuing the deliverable although it doesn't meet quality requirements is against the professional and social responsibility of a project manager. Documenting the problem in lessons learned register is a good solution for future projects, but it doesn't solve the current situation. Informing the customer that the deliverable will be late may breach the contract and harm the relationship, so the best option is to discuss the issue with the customer. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 299

choices.text: Issue the deliverable and get formal acceptance from the customer, as the deliverable meets his quality standard.
Inform the customer that the deliverable will be late and fix the fault.
Discuss the issue with the customer.
Note the problem in the lessons learned register so future projects do not face the same problem.

text: Chris is managing a product development project. He receives a call from a team member informing him that they have found the same defect which has been identified before during a previous inspection. Chris is confused how this could have happened. He has raised a change request before to repair this defect and the change was approved. After investigation, he learns that the team did not implement the approved change. This situation indicates a gap in which process?
explanation: A part of the Control Quality process is to review approved changes. Approved change requests may include modifications such as defect repairs, revised work methods, and revised schedules. The implementation of approved changes should be verified, confirmed for completeness, retested, and certified as correct. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 301

choices.text: Plan Quality Management
Control Scope
Control Quality
Perform Integrated Change Control

text: Which of the following statements best describes the difference between Validate Scope and Control Quality?
explanation: Validate Scope is concerned with the acceptance of deliverables while the Control Quality is concerned with correctness of the deliverables. Verified deliverables is an output of the Control Quality process and input to the Validate Scope process. Generally Control Quality is performed before the Validate Scope process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 164

choices.text: Validate Scope is generally performed before Control Quality.
Validate Scope is concerned with the acceptance of deliverables while the Control Quality is concerned with correctness of the deliverables.
Verified deliverables are outputs of the Validate Scope process and input to the Control Quality process.
Accepted deliverables are outputs of the Control Quality process and input to the Validate Scope process.

text: During a retrospective, a stakeholder expressed his concerns about the quality of the product increments delivered so far. The stakeholder has mentioned that the team is not able to deliver high-quality product increment. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: The best answer is that the project leader and the team need to further discuss the quality related topics first and review the quality processes. If further assistance is needed they can involve the functional manager. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 299 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 87

choices.text: Involve the quality manager to investigate the project quality processes.
Arrange training sessions for the team members to improve the quality of the product increments.
Assign more quality subject matter experts to the project to improve quality processes.
The project leader should discuss this topic with the team and review the quality processes.

text: The project team has found that the team velocity has dropped significantly and they have a critical deliverable due in two weeks. The team members decide to skip final test in order to bring the project back on track and don't miss the deliverable due date. Which of the following is a likely result of the team decision?
explanation: Removing a test will lead to technical debt which means degraded deliverables quality. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 58

choices.text: Increased technical debt
Increased customer satisfaction
Increased return on investment
Increased resources cost

text: You are managing a new construction project that is budgeted at $3,000,000. Too many activities are being executed underway on your project. You are getting worried about the accuracy of the progress reporting your team members are doing. How could you verify whether there is a problem or not?
explanation: Perform a quality audit as part of the Manage Quality process to verify that there is a problem or not. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 294 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 87

choices.text: Feasibility studies
Quality audits
Sensitivity analysis
Monte Carlo Analysis

text: Barbara is managing a large industrial project. Recently, her company received many complaints due to defects found by the customer in the first deliverable. The customer is not satisfied at all with the first project deliverable. The project sponsor is very angry and told her that the company may lose the contract with the customer if they find defects in the next deliverables. In order to reduce sponsor's stress, she told him that they will compare the product’s quality standards to those of another comparable successful products to identify best practices and increase the probability of customer acceptance. Which tool is she using?
explanation: Benchmarking is the comparison of actual or planned practices of your project to those of other projects to identify best practices and improve performance. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 284

choices.text: Matrix diagrams
Logical data model
Benchmarking
Mind mapping

text: Bill is managing an industrial project. He requested from his team to organize potential causes of quality problems into groups to know which causes they should focus on. Which tool should the team use in this situation?
explanation: Affinity diagrams can organize potential causes of defects into groups showing areas that should be focused on the most. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 293 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 178

choices.text: Control Charts
Scatter diagrams
Affinity diagrams
Why-why diagram

text: A project manager for a hardware design project and his team are using cause and effect diagram, trying to determine how various factors might have contributed to project problems. The project manager is involved in which part of the quality management process?
explanation: The key word here is (might have contributed) this means that the problem already happened, so they are involved in the Control Quality process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 304

choices.text: Total Quality Management
Control Quality
Manage Quality
Plan Quality Management

text: You are a project manager for an industrial project. Your project is being audited by the company’s quality assurance department. They have found that your team has implemented the process inefficiently, which lead to defects in your product. What’s the next thing that should happen on your project?
explanation: They are now involved in the Manage Quality process. One of the outputs of this process is Change Request. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 296

choices.text: Add the problem to the risk register and develop a response plan.
Suggest corrective actions and submit them to the change control board.
Add the results of the audit to the lessons learned.
You meet with the manager of the quality assurance department to find a solution of the problem.

text: Project deliverables are produced during the ______ process, verified during the ______ process and formally accepted during the ______ process.
explanation: Project deliverables are produced during the Direct and manage project work process, verified during the Control Quality process and formally accepted during the Validate Scope process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 299 and 305

choices.text: Perform Integrated Change Control, Control Quality, Validate Scope
Direct and manage project work, Validate Scope, Control Quality
Direct and Manage Project Work, Control Quality, Control Scope
Direct and manage project work, Control Quality, Validate Scope

text: All of the following are examples of cost of quality except:
explanation: The cost of quality is the cost incurred to prevent, discover or repair a defect. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 283 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 88

choices.text: Having team members spend extra time reviewing requirements with the stakeholders.
Paying extra labor to help meet a deadline.
Hiring extra inspectors to look for defects.
Sending a technician to repair a defective product that was delivered to the client.

text: David is managing a software project. He wants to find the strength of relationships among different factors. He asked John a more experienced project manager, John told him there is a tool that can give him information about the relationship, such as its strength, the roles played by various individuals or measurements. What is the tool which John refers to?
explanation: Matrix diagrams help find the strength of relationships among different factors, causes, and objectives that exist between the rows and columns that form the matrix. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 284

choices.text: Matrix diagrams
Logical data model
Flowcharts
Mind mapping

text: Quality audits should be
explanation: Quality audits may be scheduled or random, and may be conducted by internal or external auditors Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 295

choices.text: Scheduled with external auditors
Random with internal auditors
Scheduled or random with internal or external auditors
Scheduled with internal auditors

text: Physical resource management is concentrated in all of the following except:
explanation: Identifying roles and responsibilities of team members clearly without ambiguity is parts of managing human resources not physical resources. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 310 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 65

choices.text: Keeping enough inventory.
Allocating and using equipments.
Identifying roles and responsibilities of team members clearly without ambiguity.
Securing critical equipment and material on time.

text: If your organization is using Kaizen and and Just-In-Time (JIT) methods, you must take them into consideration when you manage your projects because they will mostly affect on:
explanation: Due to the scarce nature of critical resources, in some industries, several trends have become popular in the past several years. There is extensive literature about lean management, just-in-time (JIT) manufacturing, Kaizen, total productive maintenance (TPM), Theory of constraints (TOC), and other methods. A Project Manager should determine if the performing organisation has adopted one or more resource management tools and adapt to the project accordingly. Domain = process. PMBOK 6th edition, page 310.

choices.text: Resource Management
Procurement Management
Communication Management
Scope Management

text: You are the project manager for a software project. The project sponsor has asked you for a forecast for the cost of project completion. Which of the following is the best metric to use for forecasting?
explanation: Only ETC & VAC look forward (forecast), while CPI, SPI, SV, CV, EV & AC look backward. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

choices.text: EV and AC
SV and CV
ETC and VAC
SPI and CPI

text: Which of the following statements is true regarding project resources management?
explanation: Project resources management is concerned with managing physical and human resources. There is some overlap between Project Resource Management and Project Stakeholder Management. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 309 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 186
